title: buena_vista_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character. Voiced by [[Izumi Fuuka]].

Similarly to [[Orfevre (umamusume)|]], she was originally introduced in the old project website but was later withdrawn, only to be re-introduced with a new design in 2024.

If [[Cesario (umamusume)|]] copied [[Special Week (umamusume)|]]'s general looks, Buena Vista is a closer match to Special Week's personality while her racing outfit also matches Special Week's but in her own style, featuring her signature checkerboard pattern. Personality-wise, Buena is notably far more friendlier to almost everyone.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7761364: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7913638: Racing Outfit
* !post #8900258: [[starting_future_(umamusume)|Starting Future]]

h4. Associated characters

* [[Gentildonna (Umamusume)|]] - Roommate
* [[Special Week (Umamusume)|]] - Senpai (RL Sire)
* [[Nakayama Festa (Umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Tosen Jordan (Umamusume)|]] - Friend
* [[Dream Journey (Umamusume)|]] - Rival
* [[Cesario (Umamusume)|]] - (Fellow progeny of Special Week)

h4. See also

* [[Buena Vista (Old Design) (umamusume)|]]

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Buena Vista":[https://umamusume.jp/character/buenavista]

title: hecatia_lapislazuli
body:
[[Touhou]] character.

Based on the Greek goddess Hecate, Hecatia is a goddess who governs the Hells of the Earth, Moons and Otherworlds.  Like [[Junko (Touhou)|]], she also has a grudge against Chang'e, whose husband shot down Apollo and indirectly weakened Hell, as Hell wouldn't be able to exist without the sun. She's friends with Junko, and lent her [[Clownpiece]], her subordinate, to fulfill her plans.

She has [[red hair]], [[red eyes]] and wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[off-shoulder shirt|off-shoulder]] [[t-shirt]] (that is sometimes depicted as a [[crop top]]) along with a [[multicolored skirt|tri-colored]] [[plaid skirt]] of [[green skirt|green]], [[red skirt|red]], and [[blue skirt|blue]], and a [[black hat]]. She also carries ornaments of [[Moon (ornament)| the moon]], [[Earth (ornament)| the Earth]], and [[underworld (ornament)|the Spirit World]] with her, representing her ability to exist in 3 locations at once. Her hair and eye color change according to the ornament she wears in her hat: red when it's the Spirit World, [[blue hair|blue]] when it's [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Earth)|Earth]], and [[blonde hair|blonde]] when it's the [[Hecatia Lapislazuli (Moon)|moon]], although it's not uncommon to see her with "other objects on her head.":/pools/10382

Her fashion sense has earned her the nickname "Hot Topic-chan":/pools/10945 among fans.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6753478: Default
* !post #3477315: [[hecatia lapislazuli (earth)|Earth body]]
* !post #3118168: [[hecatia lapislazuli (moon)|Moon body]]
* !post #5826588: All three bodies

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hecatia Lapislazuli":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hecatia_Lapislazuli

title: shade_(hollow_knight)
body:
Character/enemy in [[Hollow Knight]]. [spoilers]The [b]Shade[/b] is the Void within the [[Knight (hollow knight)|]] made manifest upon their death.[/spoilers]
It holds whatever money the player was carrying when they last died, functioning as the game's equivalent to [[Dark Souls (series)|]]'s corpse run mechanic.

title: five_pebbles
body:
Five Pebbles is a [[Iterator (Rain World)|]] from the game [[Rain World]]. He is usually the second Iterator most players will meet, after [[Looks to the Moon]]

His puppet is a [[humanoid robot]] with [[pink skin]], antenna-like [[robot ears]] and markings above each eye of unequal length  vertical lines, (similar to a wireless signal strength indicator) and wears an [[orange robe]]. He is referred to with male pronouns.

He is haughty and arrogant, calling himself "god-like" in comparison to the player.

[spoiler]He is sufferring from [b]The Rot[/b] (see [[Daddy Long Legs (Rain World)|]]), a kind of biomechanical cancer, which is slowly consuming his superstructure. The game's titular rain is produced by him continually flushing his systems with vast quantities of water in an attempt to purge the corruption.[/spoiler]

title: quirrel
body: A recurring character in [[Hollow Knight]]. [b]Quirrel[/b] is a [[white mask]]ed bug who [spoilers]served as [[Monomon]]'s apprentice before she became a Dreamer, and[/spoilers] lost his memories at some point before the game.

title: tunguska_sanctuary_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Anti-Primate Biosphere, Tunguska Sanctuary[/b]
[quote]
After escaping the mayhem of the Sixth Lostbelt, Koyanskaya began to quietly but determinedly rebuild her strength. An urgent communication from Sion alerts Chaldea to the threat Koyanskaya poses, and they begin working on a plan to defeat her.

The decisive battle will take place at the headwaters of the Tunguska River in Russia, the final forest sanctuary of living things on the bleached earth. There, Master must fight to put an end to the cycle of hatred...
[/quote]

An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] after the events of [[Avalon le Fae (fate/grand order)|]]. It was released on the Japanese server on December 22, 2021, and on the NA server on December 22, 2023.

title: ultraman_tiga
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]]. His human host is [[Madoka Daigo]]. He is notable for being the first Ultraman in the franchise to be able to change forms, as well as being the first Ultra to appear in a televised series since [[Ultraman 80]], ending a 15-year semi-hiatus.

His name "Tiga" is the Malaysian/Indonesian word for "three", which is fitting, considering Tiga has three forms.

title: ryuu_ga_gotoku_(series)
body:
Series of open-world action games developed by Ryuu Ga Gotoku Studio and published by [[Sega]]. Originally known outside of Japan as the [b]Yakuza[/b] series, before switching to [b]Like a Dragon[/b] after the 7th mainline game.

The series is famous for the contrast between the serious main stories and comical side stories, numerous minigames, as well as tie-in with several [[real life]] Japanese brands.

h4. Games

* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 1]] (Yakuza)
** [[Ryuu ga Gotoku Kiwami]] (Yakuza Kiwami)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 2]] (Yakuza 2/Yakuza Kiwami 2)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku Kenzan]]
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 3]] (Yakuza 3)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 4]] (Yakuza 4)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku Of The End]] (Yakuza: Dead Souls)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 5]] (Yakuza 5)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku Ishin!]] (Like A Dragon: Ishin!)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 0]] (Yakuza 0)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 6]] (Yakuza 6: The Song of Life)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 7]] (Yakuza: Like A Dragon)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 7 Gaiden]] (Like a Dragon Gaiden: The Man Who Erased His Name)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8]] (Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth)
* [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8 Gaiden]] (Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza in Hawaii)

title: black_tape_project
body: Black electrical tape is strategically plastered in various shapes across the naked bodies of women. Joel Alvarez started The Black Tape Project in 2008 which later in 2017 became a trend in various nightclubs in Miami.

title: koseki_bijou_(casual)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Koseki Bijou]].

In this costume, she wears a [[black jacket]] with [[sleeves past wrists|sleeves past her wrists]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[miniskirt]], [[asymmetrical legwear|asymetrical]] [[single thighhigh|single]] [[black thighhighs|black thighhigh]] and a [[single leg warmer|single]] [[white leg warmers|white leg warmer]] and [[purple footwear|purple]] [[shoes]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume she has [[swept bangs]] [[hair over one eye|over her left eye]], and can either wear [[very long hair|very long]] [[twintails]] or cut it [[short hair|short]] with [[hair flaps]] similar to [[koseki bijou (1st costume)|her default costume]].

title: tenmyouji_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A character in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu ADV: Zennin Shibou Desu]]. He is an [[old man]] with slicked-back [[white hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[wrinkled skin]]. [[Quark (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]] is his adopted grandson. 

Wears a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with a turquoise [[bolo tie]], long [[black pants]], and [[black shoes]].

[spoiler]He is eventually revealed to be a 68-year-old [[Junpei (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25438568

title: orfevre_(umamusume)
body:
[tn]French: "Goldsmith"[/tn]

An [[Umamusume]] character who was the Triple Crown winner of 2011. Who is notorious for "playing" with his IRL jockey. Referred herself as the "Tyrant".

She appeared in the game in 2024 with a form much different from [[orfevre (old design) (umamusume)|a 2016 promotional character appearance]]. No explanation is given for this change, so some fan artists as a result cannot help but add some traits of the 2016 character to this one or speculate some sort of transformation.

Voiced by [[Hikasa Youko|]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #7252970: [[Tracen School Uniform]]   
* !post #8738363: Race Outfit
* !post #8896456: Race Outfit (Draft)
* !post #8738286: [[starting_future_(umamusume)|Starting Future]]

h5. Associated characters
* [[Stay Gold Clan (umamusume)|]] - All are either fellow progenies of Stay Gold or Stay Gold herself.
** [[Dream Journey (Umamusume)|]] - Older Sister, Roommate (They are full brothers in RL, Dream Journey is the eldest by almost 4 more years.)
** [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]] - ???
** [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] - Rival
** [[Fenomeno (umamusume)|]] - Rival

title: dream_journey_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A petite horse girl who follows the path of her esteemed "Elder Sister".

While at 144cm, she isn't the shortest character in the franchise, she has the absolute smallest bust with 66cm. In fact, she has the smallest proportions of any character (B66/W48/H69), having lower measurements than [[Nishino Flower (umamusume)|]] (B67/W48/H70). This is based on the fact that the real Dream Journey was one of the smallest racehorses of his caliber.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7761443: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7774743: Racing Outfit
* !post #7994117: Casual Outfit
* !post #8741403: [[starting_future_(umamusume)|Starting Future]]

h4. Associated characters
* [[Stay Gold Clan (umamusume)|]] - All are either fellow progenies of Stay Gold or Stay Gold herself.
** [[Orfevre (Umamusume)|]] - Younger Sister, Roommate (They are full brothers in RL, with Orfevre being the younger of the two by several years.)
** [[Gold Ship (Umamusume)|]] - ???
** [[Nakayama Festa (Umamusume)|]] - Rival (They actually raced each other a few times)
** [[Fenomeno (Umamusume)|]] - ???
* Other members of the 2007 generation
** [[Aston Machan (Umamusume)|]]
** [[Daiwa Scarlet (Umamusume)|]]
** [[Vodka (Umamusume)|]]
* Others
** [[Buena Vista (Umamusume)|]] - Rival
** [[Dream Journey (racehorse)]] - RL Horse
** [[Stay Gold (racehorse)]] - RL Sire, the identity of the Umamusume version's "Elder Sister". His Umamusume version is mentioned by name in Dream Journey's scenario.

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Dream Journey":[https://umamusume.jp/character/dreamjourney]

title: yaoi
body:
Any romantic and/or sexual depiction between males, doesn't matter if it's mutual or one-sided.

If it's mutual, consider adding the [[couple]] tag.

h6. Note

* While the concept of "yaoi" and "boy's love" are distinct in Japan (NSFW and SFW respectively), in the West, "yaoi" is the common term utilized, and used to refer to both - as a result, don't use shounen ai / boy's love / boy love as tags; use {{yaoi is:sfw}} or {{yaoi rating:q}} to search for BL instead, and {{yaoi rating:e}} for proper yaoi.
* While the most common concept of "boy's love" involves men with [[bishounen]] features in Japan (and in turn "yaoi" in the West), on Danbooru, as mentioned, this tag applies to any depiction of male homosexuality, including [[bara]] and [[otoko no ko]].
* Use the [[bisexual male]] tag where appropriate [b]instead[/b] of the yaoi tag.
* This tag doesn't necessarily apply to objects that characters are holding, like the cover of a manga that someone is holding. Use [[yaoi (object)]] in combination with [[fujoshi]], [[fudanshi]], and/or [[otaku]] instead. 

h4. Related tags

* [[Bishounen]] - beautiful younger males

title: tomato_(sword)
body: [[Koseki Bijou]]'s dark [[katana]], introduced with her [[koseki bijou (casual)|third costume]]. Its blade is made of the same purple gemstone as her [[chest jewel]] (and, this costume [[cracked skin|implies]], the rest of her body under her human-appearing skin), and the guard and pommel are crystals of the same gem. Its name is a play on [[yamato (sword)|Yamato]], [[vergil (devil may cry)|Vergil]]'s sword from the [i][[devil may cry (series)|Devil May Cry]][/i] series, and is (usually) pronounced "to-[i]mah[/i]-to".

title: porunga
body:
[b]Porunga[/b] is a powerful entity first debuted in [[Dragon Ball Z]]. He is the dragon god and the [[Namek]]ian equivalent of [[Shenron (dragon ball)|]]. He can be summoned via the Namekian [[Dragon Ball (object)|]]s, which are visually identical to the earth counterpart except being significantly larger in size. He appeared as a [[muscular]] [[dragon boy|humanoid dragon]] with [[red eyes]] and [[green skin]].

Porunga is considerably more powerful than Shenron, as he doesn't share certain limitations that Shenron has (such as asking for the same wishes in separate occasions). When being summoned, he is capable of granting three wishes. However, as a safety measure against evildoers, the wish can only be granted when it is wished in Namekian language.

title: rhea_(summer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[Rhea (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]] when dressed in her summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2020 "Overseas Memories":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Overseas_Memories_(Focus)] banner.

She wears a [[white bikini]] with decorative [[gold chain]]s serving both as [[necklace]] and a sort of underbust from which hangs a black [[tassel]], a white [[cape]], and what seems to be a white [[sarong]] integrated to the top itself; white [[hair flower]]s forming a [[circlet]], and white [[sandals]].

Likely to include her "weapon" in the game, a set of percusors (one per hand) that vaguely resemble palm trees with purple foliage. Extremely likely to see her along with [[Female byleth (summer) (fire emblem)|Summer Byleth]], the main character of the Duo Unit she's part of - Summer Rhea isn't her own unit in-game.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Rhea in a swimsuit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4041434

title: female_byleth_(summer)_(fire_emblem)
body:
[[Female byleth (fire emblem)|Female Byleth]] from [[Fire Emblem]] in her summer attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2020 "Overseas Memories":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Overseas_Memories_(Focus)] banner. Drawn by [[cuboon]].

She wears a [[black bikini]] with a [[halterneck]] and a pink [[tassel]] hanging between the breasts, a black and brown [[capelet]] hanging off of one shoulder, a red [[hair flower]], [[sandals]] with an [[ankle ribbon]] that are [[asymmetrical footwear]], and a [[belt]] holding a [[dagger]] with a purple sheathe. She carries a set of percusors (one per hand) that vaguely resemble palm trees with purple foliage.

Possible to see her along with [[Rhea_(Fire_Emblem)|]], the secondary character of the Duo Unit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4010610

title: ultra-ancient_giants_of_light_statues
body:
A pair of Giants of Light from [[Ultraman Tiga (series)|]], who appear alongside the enstatued [[Ultraman Tiga]] at the start of the series as statues. In the process of Tiga's resurrection, the kaiju [[Golza]] and [[Melba (ultra series)|]] would intrude and destroy the pair of the statues. With the exception of the Dark Horse comics of the series, these two would receive little-to-no acknowledgement as characters, and are often referred to as just "Tiga's companions" in English circles.

In some fan circles, it is believed that Tiga's Power and Sky Type were granted to him thanks to these two, and, following Tiga's naming scheme, the single-horned Ultra and the multipointed Ultra are nicknamed Satu and Dua, respectively based on the Malaysian/Indonesian word for "one" and "two".

h4. External links

* "Ultraman Wiki: Tiga's companions":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Tiga's_companions]

title: ultraman_blazar
body:

title: chief_of_ultraseven
body:
A character from [[Ultraseven (series)|]]. His appearance is almost identical to [[Ultraseven]]'s. Famously forgotten by Tsuburaya after his appearance, and never being developed into an actual character like his predecessor in [[Zoffy (ultra series)|]]. The last time the character was referenced in-universe was during Tsuburaya's 2010 [[April Fools]]' Day, where on Tsubutter (円谷ッター), Seven remarked that he had been contacted by someone implied to be the Chief.
 
In "Kazumine Daiji":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%80%E5%B3%B0%E5%A4%A7%E4%BA%8C]'s manga adaptation (and a 2007 short spin-off manga by him), the Chief has a larger and pointier Eye Slugger than Seven's, giving him a mohawk look, and the toy of that design gave him blue eyes as opposed to yellow eyes, to distinguish him from Seven. Before the Chief officially received his name around the time of the "Third Monster Boom":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E7%AC%AC%E4%B8%89%E6%AC%A1%E6%80%AA%E7%8D%A3%E3%83%96%E3%83%BC%E3%83%A0] ([[The Ultraman (anime)|]] and [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]), he was known as Big Seven (ビックセブン), and due to having similar-meaning names, some fans speculated that Dai Seven (大セブン) from "Tetsuji Kataoka":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%8B%E3%81%9F%E3%81%8A%E3%81%8B%E5%BE%B9%E6%B2%BB]'s manga [i]Ultraseven Monogatari[/i] was the same character as the Chief. Some fans also like to joke he was the actual protagonist of [[Ultra Fight]]'s newly-made fight scenes.

h4. Appearance

* !post #8315160

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Chief of Ultraman":https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Chief_of_Ultraseven

title: maria_(hayate_no_gotoku!)
body:
Second female main character of [[Hayate no Gotoku!]]

[[Sanzen'in Nagi]]'s seventeen-year-old personal maid and colleague to her butler [[Ayasaki Hayate]]. Maria is a prodigy who graduated from Hayate and Nagi's school four years prior, and also acts as Nagi's mother figure. While caring and insightful (being aware of Nagi's one-sided affection for Hayate), she is deathly afraid of cockroaches and is extremely defensive about her age (itself ambiguous, as she was originally an orphan found as an infant next to a statue of the Virgin Mary, after whom she was named).
other_names: マリア(ハヤテのごとく!)

title: nahui_mictlan_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 7: Golden Sea of Trees Travelogue, Nahui Mictlan: Those Who Rule the Planet[/b]
[quote]The Foreign God has attacked the Wandering Sea. Chaldea escapes in the Storm Border, though at a great cost. Now they begin their attempt to enter the seventh Lostbelt and finally put a stop to the Foreign God's terrible machinations.

This seventh Lostbelt is situated in the Amazon rainforest of South America. A lush, fertile land brimming with trees, this place nurtured many forms of life. This place is said to be the wellspring of all life on Earth. But, with the Tree of Emptiness haven taken root, this place has become a wasteland of death, of cracked soil and parched earth, overhung with rumbling thunderheads.

Why is this once-lush land now dead? What course did this Lostbelt's history take?

In this harsh South American Lostbelt, devoid of all life, humanity readies itself to confront the only remaining threat.[/quote]

The seventh and final Lostbelt story arc in [[Fate/Grand Order]], taking place in South America and supervised by the Crypter [[Daybit Sem Void]].

Part 1 was released on the Japanese server on December 25, 2022, and on the NA server on December 25, 2024. Part 2 was released on the Japanese server on January 31, 2023, and on the NA server on January 15, 2025.

title: olympus_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 5: Interstellar Mountainous City, Olympus[/b]
[quote]
Four Lostbelts have been cut away from Proper Human History.
As they break through the great ocean that remained unchanged since the Age of Gods, the Chaldeans see before them a Tree of Emptiness that stretches out into space, along with a giant floating city towering majestically over all, symbolizing the absolute rule of the gods.

Olympus...

A throne for the superior deities and a great Interstellar city so massive that even the vast sea of the skies is no obstacle to it.

The final battle for humanity versus the gods...and Master versus Crypter begins here, at the epicenter of the fifth Lostbelt.
[/quote]
The second part of the fifth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in the city of Olympus and supervised by the Crypter [[Kirschtaria Wodime]]. The first part of the Lostbelt is covered during the [[Atlantis (fate/grand order)|]] chapter. Released on the Japanese server on April 9, 2020 and on the NA server on March 24, 2022.

title: imaginary_scramble
body:
[b]Concave Illogical Number, Imaginary Trench[br]Great Void Sea Battle, Imaginary Scramble - To the Surface, Nautilus![/b]
[quote]
This is a story a bit before the fifth Lostbelt...

During a Void Space submersion training session in anticipation of the upcoming battle against Kirschtaria, the Nautilus suddenly runs aground on a mysterious object in uncharted waters. During their attempt to escape from Void Space, the crew encounters a castaway who has been adrift on the sea of Imaginary Numbers.

"I'm waiting for you...in the uncharted sea and rainbow dream."

This is the Reverse Side of the World, a realm that has never been observed. Simultaneously the shallowest and deepest pitfall...the closest, furthest underworld in this world.

Who could be calling from the bottomless sea of Imaginary Numbers?
[/quote]
An event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] taking place after the events of [[Yugakshetra (fate/grand order)|]]. It was released on the Japanese server on November 11, 2020 and on the NA server on October 27, 2022.

title: yugakshetra_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 4: Saṃsāra of Genesis and Terminus, Yugakshetra[/b]
[quote]
In this journey to cut down the Fantasy Trees, the battles in the Lostbelts grow more intense. To prepare for the inevitable confrontation with Kirschtaria, Chaldea journeys to the fourth Lostbelt in search of supplies and reinforcements.

The Indian Lostbelt.
Not a hint of devastation is seen in this land, where the people pray to their god each day and live humble lives. Where the Chinese Lostbelt was governed by the laws of men, this Lostbelt is a pure land ruled by the laws of its god.

What awaits the Master of Chaldea in this world trapped in perpetual Saṃsāra meant to purge all Evils?
[/quote]
The fourth Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[India]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Scandinavia Peperoncino]]. Released on the Japanese server on June 15, 2019 and on the NA server on June 3, 2021.

title: s_i_n_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 3: The Synchronized Intellect Nation, S I N[/b]
[quote]
Shortly after Chaldea settles in at their new base, an assassin strikes, attempting to poison members of their group.
In a desperate bid to save the lives of the assassin's would-be victims, Chaldea makes its way to the third Lostbelt, hoping to find an antidote.

They arrive in a land of eternal peace, brought on by the end of all conflict between nations.
This land knows no struggle, no tragedy, no fragility... a truly idyllic world. Time passes gently, and the people live comfortable lives. And yet...
[/quote]
The third Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[China]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Akuta Hinako]]. In this universe, the first emperor of China [[Shi Huang Di (fate)|]] managed to obtain immortality, allowing for his eternal rule.

Released on the Japanese server on November 27, 2018 and on the NA server on November 26, 2020.

title: gotterdammerung_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 2: The Eternal Icy Fire Century, Götterdämmerung[/b]
[quote]
The Baldanders of the Wandering Sea: one of the three major organizations of the magecraft world, considered to be the primordial, yet final "wall".
There, no progress or changes in magecraft arising from the evolution of civilization are acknowledged. Only Mystics from the Age of Gods are permitted in this group of mages, making it incompatible with modern human society.
The Shadow Border receives a transmission from an unknown sender containing directions to this new territory. Placing their trust in this uncertain, unconfirmed information, the protagonist and company head towards the island of the Age of Gods, hidden away in the North Sea...
[/quote]
The second Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Ophelia Phamrsolone]]. Set after 1000 BC in Scandinavia, Ragnarok was interrupted due to [[Surtr (fate)|]] devouring Fenrir, causing him to gain Fenrir's authority and bringing an immature Twilight to the world. After he was defeated, with Ragnarok being unfinished the world is now forcibly ravaged by fire and ice for 3 millennia.

Released on the Japanese server on July 18, 2018 and on the NA server on June 23, 2020.

h4. Characters
h6. Novum Chaldea
* [[Leonardo da Vinci (Rider) (fate)|]]
* [[Goredolf Musik]]
* [[Jingle Abel Meuniere]]
* [[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Male)]]/[[Fujimaru Ritsuka (Female)]]
* [[Sherlock Holmes (fate)|]]

title: anastasia_(lostbelt)_(fate/grand_order)
body:
[b]Lostbelt No. 1: Permafrost Empire, Anastasia[/b]
[quote]
On that fateful day, the future was wiped clean. Invaders from another world have swept aside human history, bringing everything back to the beginning.
Our achievements were undone, and Proper Human History was no longer even a part of the past.
The observatory is frozen, and the world itself split into seven Lostbelts.
And now...
After three months of silence, the last remaining humans surface from the Sea of Void. They journey through a frigid, icy world, shut out from history.
April, 2018... The battle to reclaim the world and its history begins.
[/quote]
The first Lostbelt in [[Fate/Grand Order]], set in [[Russia]] and supervised by the Crypter [[Kadoc Zemlupus]]. Here, an [[asteroid]] hit the planet in 1570 and caused an ice age, resulting in most of humanity to go extinct; however [[Ivan the Terrible (fate)|]] was able to save his country by transforming the remaining humans (including himself) into Yaga by merging them with magical beasts.

Released on the Japanese server on April 4, 2018 and on the NA server on March 27, 2020.

title: snow_(mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku)
body:
[[mahoutsukai_no_yakusoku|Mahoyaku]] character.

Snow (スノウ) is a wizard that resides within the Northern Country. He is the twin brother of [[White (mahoutsukai no yakusoku)|]]. He is known to usually take on the appearance of a child, but he can also change his appearance to resemble that of an adult. He is rumored to be alive for thousands of years. Thoughtful and majestic, but sometimes mischievous.

Japanese CV: Shintaro Asanuma

h4. Appearance

* [b]Hair:[/b] [[black_hair]]
* [b]Eyes:[/b] [[yellow_eyes]]

Hint: A notable difference between the twins is that Snow's hair goes down his neck. White's hair, on the other hand, is shorter in the back.
other_names: スノウ(魔法使いの約束)

title: owl_ears
body:
Tufts of feathers on the top of the head of some species of owl that resemble ears. They are not the owl's actual ears, which are located on the side of their faces, adjacent to their eyes.

On Danbooru, this refers to characters who have these tufts (most notably owl-based characters from [[Kemono Friends]]) or wear accessories resembling them.

title: large_hands
body:
Hands that are larger than normal. More specifically, the hands tend to be as big as the head, or slightly bigger.  This does not take into account [[perspective]] or [[foreshortening]].

Having hands larger than normal is generally considered to be a masculine trait that some find attractive, so much so it has become a trope in the [[yaoi]] genre, often called "Yaoi hands". However, large hands can be a character design choice as well, especially as a way to imply that the character isn't completely "human". Since this design choice is not very common, the hand sizes for such characters tend to be more variable, especially in fan art.

Not to be confused with [[oversized forearms]].

h4. Examples

* !post #6443268: [[Franky (one piece)|]] ([[One Piece]]) 
* !post #7005666: [[Ashiya Douman (fate)|]][br]([[Fate/Grand Order]]) 
* !post #4253264: [[Mountain (arknights)|]] ([[Arknights]])

h4. See also

* [[hand size difference]]
* [[small hands]]
* [[large feet]]

title: oversized_forearms
body:
When a character has larger than normal forearms or hands.
 
h4. Related tags
* [[large hands]]
* [[forearms]]

title: hev_suit
body:
[b]H[/b]azardous [b]E[/b]n[b]v[/b]ironment suit

The suit that [[Gordon Freeman]] and other trained [[Black Mesa Science Team]] personnel wear during specific tests. It is a full body orange and black/grey armor, with the [[lambda symbol|lambda letter]] (λ) stamped on it.

Its helmet looks like those of hazmat suits, but it is seldom used by player characters in story. It can be seen during Deathmatches by players using the model, and [spoiler]on dead scientists in Xen.[/spoiler]

It's one of the icons of [[Half-Life (series)|]] and the whole franchise along with the [[crowbar]].

h4. See also
* [[hazmat suit]]
* [[tag group:attire]]

h4. External links
* Combine Overwiki: "Hazardous Environment Suit":https://combineoverwiki.net/wiki/Hazardous_Environment_Suit

title: lambda_symbol
body:
Eleventh letter of the Greek alphabet, and precursor to both the Latin letter L and the Cyrillic letter El (Л).
The lowercase variant (λ) is also a recurring symbol of the [[Half-Life (series)|]] franchise, typically associated with [[Gordon Freeman]], Black Mesa and the rebellion against the Combine in [[Half-Life 2]].
h4. External links
"Wikipedia: Lambda":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lambda]

title: long-eared_miyabi_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] in the [[Zenless Zone Zero]] community revolving around depicting [[Hoshimi Miyabi]] with [[very long ears]].

Gained popularity from [[nepnepping]]'s drawings of Miyabi when a fan said "I think the ears are too small," prompting edits where her ears are made [[too long|even larger]]. Also often combined with "[[I'm all ears (meme)|]]" meme.

title: hoshi_no_sanzang-chan_tenjiku_ni_iku
body:
[b]Sanzang Coming to the West[/b]
[quote]Just a normal day at Chaldea— Or so you thought, but this is... The world of "Journey to the West"?!
Sha Wujing and Zhu Bajie? Haven't we met somewhere?
As the first disciple of the monk Xuangzang Sanzang, you find yourself leading this ragtag band to Tianzhu.
GO WEST!
[/quote]
A limited-time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], released on the Japanese server on June 15, 2016 and on the NA server on May 31, 2018. The event notably depicts [[Mordred (fate/apocrypha)|]] as the child of [[Artoria Pendragon (Lancer Alter) (fate)|]] and [[Florence Nightingale (fate)|]], spawning various fanart of the three as a family and the latter two as a couple.

body:
[b]The Demonic Capital: Rashoumon[/b]
[quote]This Rayshift takes you to the streets of ancient Kyoto.
With cherry blossoms in extravagant bloom, it's a beautiful sight, but there's something peculiar about the inhabitants...
A sweet scent beckons you to—Oni-slaying with Kintarou?
Whether a dream or an illusion, all Masters will need to band together to defeat the ferocious Oni. But what awaits you beyond the battle?

title: nero_matsuri
body:
[b]Nero Fest ~The Colosseum of Victory~[/b]
[quote]
[b]The time is now!!!![/b]
Rejoice, my beloved Roman citizen!
Be prosper and enjoy, the ample and extravagant Rome!
I hereby announce the start of the new Olympia, the start of Nero Fest!
In the Colosseum built especially for this day, display your might, grasp glory and reward with your own hands!
[/quote]
The first limited-time event in [[Fate/Grand Order]], first held on the Japanese server starting on September 16, 2015 and on the NA server on July 25, 2017. It would have reruns with new Craft Essences and additional story scenes three times, in 2016, 2017, and 2021.

title: getter_robo_(classic)
body:
The original [[Getter Robo]] manga and anime series, created by [[Ishikawa Ken (character)|]] and [[Nagai Gou (artist)|]]. Both the anime and manga premiered in April 1974 and ran until August 1975. 

Despite running alongside each other, the manga and anime are vastly different. The anime features a more family friendly episodic format, while the manga tells a continuous story and features more graphic violence.

title: getter_robo_arc
body:
The fifth part of the [[Getter Robo]] saga. It was the last part of the series written by creator [[Ishikawa Ken (character)|]], and did not receive a definitive ending due to his untimely passing during the series' run. 

An anime adaptation aired in 2021.

title: ishikawa_ken_(character)
body:
Deceased Mangaka. (June 28, 1948 - November 15, 2006)

Co-creator (with Go Nagai) of the [[Getter Robo]] saga.
Creator of [[Kyomu_Senki]], [[Amon_Saga: Tsuki_no_Miko]], and the manga adaptations of [[Fatal_Fury]] and [[Makai_Tenshou]].

title: fujiko_f_fujio_(style)
body:
Posts done in the style of [[Fujiko F Fujio (character)|Fujiko F. Fujio]], most commonly known for the art of [[Doraemon]]. Can be easily identified by oval-shaped eyes with simplified irises, rounded face, and simplified body propotions.

Also applicable to posts based on the style of his long-time partner Fujiko Fujio A. which shares similar style with Fujiko F. Fujio.

title: doraemon
body:
[b]Doraemon[/b] is a Japanese manga series from 1969 written and illustrated by [[fujiko f fujio (character)|Fujiko F. Fujio]], which later became an anime series and later the most successful anime franchise of all time, spawned over 40 movies and a broad range of merchandises. 

The series is about a robotic cat named [[Doraemon (character)|]], who travels back in time from the 22nd century to aid a pre-teen boy [[Nobi Nobita]] and alter his family's doomed life in the future.

h4. Characters

title: cambyses_ii
body:
Persian Emperor of the 6th century who invaded Egypt.
He is best known for the legend of his "Lost Army" and "Cats at the battle of Pelusium".

[[fujiko f fujio (character)|Fujiko F. Fujio]] made a short sci-fi manga, "”Cambyses no Kuji (The Draw of Cambyses)”":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%AB%E3%83%B3%E3%83%93%E3%83%A5%E3%82%BB%E3%82%B9%E3%81%AE%E7%B1%A4 in 1977 out of his conquest of Kush ("Ethiopia" in the story).

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cambyses_II]

title: tp_bon
body:
T・P Bon, pronounced as [b]Time Patrol Bon[/b], is a [[science fiction]] manga series by [[fujiko f fujio (character)|Fujiko·F·Fujio]]. It was adapted into a 90 minute anime special in 1989.

Unlike several organizations with the same name in other science fictions, the Time Patrol in this series is not a time police but a kind of rescue team. They use [[hover bike]]-style time machines and short-term memory erasing devices.

h4.Characters

* [[Namihira Bon]]
* [[Riimu Stream]]
* [[Buyoyon]]
* [[Yasukawa Yumiko]]
  

h4.See Also

* "Wikipedia article (Japanese)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/T・Pぼん

title: fujiko_f_fujio_(character)
body:
[b]Fujiko F. Fujio[/b] was a pseudonym for [b]Fujimoto Hiroshi[/b] (藤本 弘) (1933-1996), a legendary and influrential manga artist.

Originally he partnered with his long time friend and fellow manga artist Abiko Motoo (安孫子 素雄) with the duo working under the name Fujiko Fujio (藤子不二雄). The duo dissolved their partnership in 1982 due to creative differences and Fujimoto's declining health prompting the duo to settle on their copyright issue, they later published their own works with [b]F[/b]ujimoto as Fujiko [b]F.[/b] Fujio and [b]A[/b]biko as Fujiko Fujio [b]A[/b]. 

He is best known for [i][[Doraemon]][/i] (initially published under Fujiko Fujio, but it was solely written by Fujimoto from the beginning).

In several commentaries and [[artist self-insert]], Fujiko F. Fujio often depicted himself with a [[smoking pipe]] and wearing a [[beret]]. As such, this tag covers both the "avatar" he used in his works as well as posts that depict Fujimoto himself.

h4. See also
* [[Fujiko F Fujio (copyright)]] - reference lists of works done by Fujiko F. Fujio and Fujiko Fujio A
* [[Fujiko F Fujio (style)]]

title: kamen_rider_knight_survive
body:
[[Kamen Rider Knight]]'s power up form.

h4. List of [[Advent Card|Advent Cards]] owned
* [b]Sword Vent[/b]: Split [[Dark Visor Zwei]] into the sword ‘[b]Dark Blade[/b]’ and the [[shield]] ‘[b]Dark Shield[/b]’. The splitting can be done without this Card.
* [b]Shoot Vent[/b]: Transforms the Dark Visor Zwei into its [[crossbow]] form, the ‘[b]Dark Arrow[/b]’. It is capable of shooting [[energy arrow]] by absorbing sunlight.
* [b]Blust Vent[/b]: [[DarkRaider]] spins its wing wheels to create a gust of wind called a ‘[b]Dark Storm[/b]’, which blows the target away.
** In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, the name was changed to “[b]Blast Vent[/b]”.
* [b]Trick Vent[/b]: He activates ‘[b]Shadow Illusion[/b]’, the special move that creates multiple [[clone|clones]] of himself.
* [b]Final Vent[/b]: Launch ‘[b]Shippuu-Dan[/b]’, the most powerful special move. Drives DarkRaider that has been transformed into motorbike form and wraps itself in [[cloak|cloaks]] around the entire vehicle body before transforming into a missile form and charging forward. It can also fire a special beam before transforming, disabling the target.

title: kamen_rider_ryuki
body:
Lead Rider of [[kamen_rider_ryuki_(series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]], twelfth show of the Kamen Rider series and third of the Heisei generation, as well as the first Rider from the same generation to be given an American adaptation, [i]Dragon Knight[/i].

Rookie journalist Kidou Shinji finds himself in the middle of the Rider War, a deathmatch between 13 Kamen Riders, upon making a contract with [[Dragreder]], a Mirror Monster (themselves responsible for mysterious deaths throughout the city), to transform into Ryuki, fighting both Mirror Monsters and other Riders, as well as uncovering the truth of the Rider War.

Ryuki has a red color scheme and is modeled after both the Chinese dragon and a knight. He also uses Advent Cards to enhance his combat capabilities. Finally, he can upgrade into the bulkier, more powerful Ryuki Survive Form.

h4. See also
* [[Kamen Rider Ryuki Survive]]

title: kamen_rider_knight
body:
The secondary Rider of [[kamen rider ryuki (series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]], a serious, hard to please man. His real name is [b][[Akiyama Ren]][/b]. His dark motif, no-nonsense attitude and bat-styled transformation have led to many comparisons to [[Batman]].

h4. See also
* [[Kamen Rider Knight Survive]]

title: kasane_teto_(utau)
body:
[[Kasane Teto]]'s original [[UTAU]] design, which is basically a derivative of [[Hatsune Miku]]'s original V2 design.

She has [[red eyes]] and [[red hair]] with [[twin drills]]. She wears a [[sleeveless shirt]] with [[breast pocket]]s and buttons down the center, [[detached sleeves]], [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] and [[thighhighs]]. Her shirt, skirt, and sleeves are a dark blue, though also commonly depicted as black. She has a [[shoulder tattoo]] of the numbers 0401 (her birthday) on her left arm.

title: advent_deck
body:
Tools from “[[Kamen Rider Ryuki (series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]]”. They are cases for storing [[Advent Card|Advent Cards]].

By holding it out towards the reflective surface, the transformer is equipped with [[V Buckle]]. Attaching it to V Buckle as it is transforms the transformer into a Kamen Rider.

When the owner enters into a contract with a Mirror Monster, a crest symbolising that Monster appears on this surface.

In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, it was also used as a substitute for a [[shield]].

title: advent_card
body:
[[card|Cards]] used by the Kamen Riders in “[[kamen_rider_ryuki_(series)|Kamen Rider Ryuki]]”.

Cards pulled from the [[Advent Deck]] are scanned with the Visor to produce the appropriate effect for that Card.
Once a Card has been used, it cannot be reused unless it is once untransformed.

h2. List
* [b]Contract[/b]: The Card for contracting the Mirror Monster.
* [b]Seal[/b]: The card is designed to protect the cardholder from Mirror Monsters. It is not possible to have this and ‘Advent’ at the same time.
* [b]Advent[/b]: Summons the contracted Mirror Monster. This is a variant of ‘Contract’.
* [b]Final Vent[/b]: Cooperate with contracted Mirror Monster to perform special moves.
* [b]Sword Vent[/b]: Summons weapons such as [[sword]], [[lance]], or [[naginata]].
* [b]Strike Vent[/b]: Summon weapons that fit in the hand, such as [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] or [[claw_(weapon)|claws]].
* [b]Guard Vent[/b]: Summon [[shield]] and other protective gear, or have contracted Mirror Monster defend against enemy attacks.
* [b]Shoot Vent[/b]: The Card for long-range attacks. Summons the [[cannon]] or activates a special move.
* [b]Swing Vent[/b]: Summon the [[whip]].
* [b]Spin Vent[/b]: Summons the [[drill]] type weapon.
* [b]Hold Vent[/b]: Summons the [[yo-yo]] type weapon.
* [b]Nasty Vent[/b]: Let the contracted Mirror Monster interfere with the enemy's actions.
* [b]Trick Vent[/b]: Multiple [[clone|clones]] emerge.
* [b]Copy Vent[/b]: It duplicates weapons and protective gear summoned by another Kamen Rider and makes it its own.
** [[Kamen Rider Verde|Verde]]'s Card mimics it plus the opponent's appearance.
* [b]Confine Vent[/b]: Cancels the effect of an Card used by an enemy Kamen Rider.
* [b]Return Vent[/b]: Allows a Card that has been disabled by a Confine Vent to be used again.
* [b]Steal Vent[/b]: Take away a weapon or protective gear equipped by an enemy Kamen Rider.
* [b]Clear Vent[/b]: Make the Cardholder [[invisible]]. If the owner has been in contact with other Kamen Rider, it applies to that one as well.
* [b]Blust Vent[/b]: The contracted Mirror Monster creates a gust of wind. 
** In “[[Kamen Rider Dragon Knight]]”, the name was changed to “[b]BLAST VENT[/b]”.
* [b]Strange Vent[/b]: When scanned, it changes into a different kind of Card.
* [b]Unite Vent[/b]: Fuse the contracted mirror monsters.
* [b]Freeze Vent[/b]: Freezes the enemy, thereby blocking their movement.
* [b]Time Vent[/b]: [[Kamen Rider Odin|Odin]]-specific Card. Turn back time.
* [b]Survive[/b]: Power up to Survive form. There are three cards in existence: “Flame”, “Gale”, and “Infinite”.
* [b]Accele Vent[/b]: Temporarily accelerate the Cardholder.
* [b]Wheel Vent[/b]: Transforms the contracted Mirror Monster into motorbike form.
* [b]Link Vent[/b]: Card added in “Kamen Rider Dragon Knight”. Multiple Kamen Riders cooperate to perform special moves.

title: kaela_kovalskia
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia]]'s [[holoh3roes|3rd generation]]. An apprentice of a famous blacksmith who joined the secret agency in search of a legendary material. Designed by [[Yasuda Suzuhito]].

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] [[red eyes]] and [[medium breasts]] (although to the revealing nature of her default outfits artist tend to exaggerate her bust size). Her default hairstyle has [[double-parted bangs|double-parted]] [[swept bangs]] and a [[single sidelock]] on her right and is decorated with a [[red hairband]] and a [[red bow|red]] [[hair bow]], she also wears a pair of [[red-tinted eyewear|red]] [[sunglasses]] styled after welding goggles [[eyewear on head|on her head]].

title: chocolate_bird_(meme)
body:
[b]Chocolate Bird[/b] refers to a scene in the 2011 movie [[Jack and Jill (movie)|]] where a CGI [[cockatoo]] walks into and drinks from a [[chocolate fountain]]. Gained notoriety when screenshots and GIFs of the scene were posted on [[Tumblr]] without context, leading many to believe it was depicting a real bird.

Associated with the phrase "Listen here, cumslut", which one Tumblr user said towards another in a popular reblog chain.

h4. External links

* "KnowYourMeme: Chocolate Bird":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/events/chocolate-bird

title: jo_lolita
body:
A fashion style that combines traditional [[Korean clothes|Korean clothing]] with [[Lolita fashion]]. Jo being short for Joseon, referencing the "Korean Joseon era":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseon].

Jo lolita is esentially a lolita interpretation of the [[hanbok]] (clothes used during Joseon era). Common features are a [[long skirt]] ([[chima (clothes)|]]) and a [[jeogori (clothes)|]]. In a traditional hanbok the jeogori is tucked in, however in jo lolita the skirt (chima) is usually shorter, exposing the jeogori.

h4. Examples

* !post #8964707

h4. See also

* [[Lolita fashion]]
* [[Korean clothes]]
* [[Wa lolita]]
* [[Qi lolita]]

title: implied_self-harm
body:
When a picture strongly suggests someone has committed or may commit [[self-harm]] without depicting the act itself, the wounds caused, or blood at all.

A common way is to include a [[boxcutter]] in the scene somewhere, especially in locations where a boxcutter wouldn't normally be, such as a [[bathroom]]. Another is for a character to have unexplained [[bandaged wrist]]s.

title: coyopotato
body: A mascot character associated with [[Kemono Friends V Project|Kemono Friends]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]], [[Coyote (kemono friends)|]]. It was created during her first live drawing stream.

title: coyote_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

One of the few Friends to have obtained a redesign after the release of the original game which is first displayed as a card for Bushiroad's ChaosTCG. There, she fully embraces the image of [[wile e coyote|Wile E. Coyote]] with her new outfit and design (as well as a more explicit rivalry with [[Greater Roadrunner (kemono friends)|]]).

On December 4, 2021 she was debuted as one of the [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]]s of [[Kemono Friends V Project]], and is currently the only member of the group that primarily streams in English.

On April 11th, 2025, she has "announced":https://x.com/Coyote_KEMOV/status/1910704587738407276 that she will be graduating from KemoV at the end of May.

h4. Related tags

* [[Coyopotato]]

title: indian_style
body:
[[Sitting]] with the butt on the ground and the legs crossed at the ankles, pretzel style. Also known as sitting [b]cross-legged[/b] in English, as [b]tailor style[/b] or [b]Turkish style[/b] in several European languages, and as [b]agura[/b] (胡坐) in Japanese, where it is the traditional informal male sitting style.

Do not confuse this tag for Indian-styled clothing. Those are tagged as [[Indian clothes]].

title: kamen_rider_2_(shin)
body:
h6. Batta Augment 02, Ichimonji Hayato.

A former freelance photographer, Hayato was augmented by the organization SHOCKER into a prana-using cyborg. Possessing the ability to transform into his combat mode without the need for speed, he is considered superior to the original Batta Augment, [[kamen rider 1 (shin) |01]].

He derives his happiness from freedom.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7896292: Coat removed, with [[kamen rider 1 (shin)|No. 1]] and [[Midorikawa Ruriko|Ruriko]]
* !post #6933973: Coat on, with [[kamen rider 1 (shin)|No. 1]]

title: kamen_rider_1_(shin)
body:
h6. Batta Augment 01, Takeshi Hongo. 

The son of a fallen police officer, Takeshi Hongo was kidnapped and heavily augmented by the insidious organization SHOCKER as an agent to further their goals of human happiness. Freed by Dr. Hiroshi Midorikawa and his daughter Ruriko, he is tasked with protecting both her and humanity from SHOCKER's misguided ends. He is equipped with a Prana condensing belt, the custom Cyclone motorbike and his augmentations provide superior strength, speed, and agility compared to a normal human.

He derives his happiness from kindness.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7541442: Coat removed
* !post #6933973: Coat on, with [[kamen rider 2 (shin)|No. 2]]

title: arabian_nights
body:
[i]The Arabian Nights[/i], also known as [i]One Thousand and One Nights[/i], is a collection of Middle Eastern folk tales compiled in Arabic during the Islamic Golden Age, compiled by various authors over many hundreds of years.

Though each collection features different stories, they are set within a frame story of the sultan [[Shahrayar]] and [[scheherazade_(arabian_nights)|Scheherazade]]:

After discovering that his first wife is unfaithful, Shahrayar kills her. Then, loathing all womankind, he marries and kills a new virgin each day until no more candidates can be found. Scheherazade, his vizier's daughter, having devised a scheme to save herself and others, offers herself as the next bride. Each evening she tells a story, leaving it incomplete and promising to finish it the following night. The king, curious about how the story ends, is thus forced to postpone her execution in order to hear the end. The next evening, she finishes that story and then begins another, following the same pattern for 1,001 nights.

h4. List of tagged stories within Arabian Nights

* [[Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves]]
* [[Aladdin (Arabian Nights)|]], main character of "[i]The Wonderful Lamp[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aladdin
** [[Aladdin (movie)|]], Disney version of story

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One_Thousand_and_One_Nights

title: animal_ears
body:
A character with animal ears, real or [[fake animal ears|fake]]. Also known as [i]kemonomimi[/i]. Do not use this tag for pictures of actual [[animal]]s. 

There are two areas where animal ears are usually placed. On top of the head and on the sides of the head (where a human's ears would be). The first type is much easier to [[fake_animal_ears|accessorize]] but anatomically incorrect. The inverse is true for the second type. The first type is most likely to have [[extra_ears|extra human ears]]. For the second type, "extra ears" usually means a redundant accessory.

title: ariel_(disney)
body:
The [[red hair|red-haired]] [[mermaid]] from the animated [[Disney]] film [[the little mermaid (disney)|The Little Mermaid]].
Ariel is based on the protagonist of Hans Christian Andersen's fairytale "The Little Mermaid", but was developed into a different personality for the 1989 animated film adaptation. Her distinct appearance consists of [[very long hair|long red hair]], a green tail, and a [[shell bikini|lavender seashell bra.]]

Ariel is voiced by Jodi Benson in most of her appearances and is the 4th official Disney Princess.

h4. See also

title: princess_royale
body:
An illustration contest, themed on battle heroines in mythologies and fairy tales, held by Pixiv and 2.5-Jigen TV internet television company from October to November 2012. 

Like many Pixiv contests, non-winning entries were often taken down by artists after the contest period ended, leaving Danbooru and similar archive sites as one of the only places preserving the works.

h4. Contest Details
The contest ran from October 11 to November 28, 2012. Entries were tagged with プリンセスロワイヤルイラストコンテスト. 
The goal was to "draw an original fairy tale or mythologically-themed heroine in a modern, fantasy, or even science fiction setting. Be sure to include their trademark “battle” style (e.g. superpower or weapons)!" "[1]":[/wiki_pages/40514#dtext-external-links]

For a given character, multiple winners could be selected.


h4. Contest Results 
Contest results were announced on 2012-12-19. There were 3068 people who entered. Winners received a "2.5 Dimension TV Award", which meant ¥50,000 prize money. While the original announcement said 20 or more winners would be selected, in fact 50 winners were selected:

title: scylla
body:
A type of [[monster girl]] resembling a sea [[octopus]], most commonly taking the form in Japanese works of a human upper torso and [[tentacles]] for legs.  

Named after a Greek mythological monster that has had many varying descriptions over the centuries.  One later mythological version of the scylla was more or less a [[mermaid]] whose serpentine-like lower half was surrounded by snapping dog heads. For that character, use [[scylla (mythology)]] instead.

Other names associated with octopus girls are Cecaelia and Dagon.

h4. Notable Scyllas

title: tyson_tan
body:
[b]Tyson Tan[/b] is a Chinese concept artist, specializing in cute [[robot]] and [[furry]] characters.
[b]钛山[/b] 是一位中国大陆的概念画师，擅长绘制可爱的 [[robot|机器人]] 和 [[furry|福瑞]] 角色。

h2. Featured/作品精选
* !post #9052407
* !post #9096739
* !post #9053638
* !post #9092318

h2.Personal projects
* [[Electric Hearts]], a science fiction project featuring robots.
* [[Spirit Animals in Disguise]], a fantasy project featuring furry characters.

h2.个人项目
* [[Electric Hearts|电子之心]]，机器人角色主导的科幻项目。
* [[Spirit Animals in Disguise|千变灵兽]]，福瑞角色主导的玄幻项目。

h2.Known for
* [[Kiki the Cyber Squirrel]], the mascot of [[Krita (software)|]].
* [[Konqi]], the mascot of [[KDE]].
* [[libbie_the_spirit_oryx|Libbie]], the rejected mascot contest entry for LibreOffice.
* [[Freedom Planet]] franchise, as character designer and general pixel artist.
* Many other free and open source mascots and Chinese translation works.

h2.知名作品和事迹
* [[Kiki the Cyber Squirrel|电子松鼠琪琪]]，[[Krita (software)|]] 的吉祥物。
* [[Konqi|恐奇]]，[[KDE]] 的吉祥物。
* [[libbie_the_spirit_oryx|电子剑羚欧阳理碧]]，被组织方排除的 LibreOffice 吉祥物比赛投稿。
* [[Freedom Planet|自由星球]] 系列游戏，作为角色设计师和各种像素图画师。
* 其他许多自由开源软件项目的吉祥物和中文翻译工作。

h2.License
Tyson Tan's works are licensed under Creative Common BY-SA.

h2.许可证
钛山的作品使用知识共享 BY-SA 许可证进行授权。

title: electric_hearts
body:
[b]Electric Hearts[/b] is a science fiction project created by [[Tyson Tan]].
[b]电子之心[/b]是[[Tyson Tan|钛山]]创作的科幻项目。

h2. Featured/作品精选
* !post #9052407
* !post #9052421
* !post #9052427
* !post #9052440
* !post #9097657

h2.Lore/设定
English: "Lore page on Tyson Tan's website":[https://tysontan.com/electric-hearts-top/]
中文: "钛山的个人网站的设定页面":[https://tai3.cn/electric-hearts-top/]

h2.Introduction

Follow [[Alice Rosetta]], the first robot with true artificial intelligence. Witness her growth in today’s world and her adventures in the future.

* Cute and approachable mech designs
* Detailed and reality-based world building
* Everyday life-focused stories and plots

[b]Note: [/b]Electric Hearts is set in the same universe as [[Spirit Animals in Disguise]].

h2.简介

本作品跟随人类首个真人工智能机器人[[Alice Rosetta|爱理诗]]的视角，讲述她在当代的成长历程和在未来的奇妙冒险。

* 可爱且人性化的机器外形设计
* 详细且写实化的机器性能设定
* 日常生活主导的剧情

[b]提示：[/b]本作品与钛山的另一个作品“[[Spirit Animals in Disguise|千变灵兽]]”共享世界观。


h2. Names of the project
"Because the development time of this project has been so long, it had been renamed a few times for various reasons. But regardless of the names, they all point to the same thing."

* [b]Electric Hearts[/b] (first and current name)
* inter.Natal (x)
* Oasis (x)
* Xing (x)
* SYNC (x)
* A3 (x)

h2. Current state and plans
DONE: Electric Heart's art style has been developed to the point that I can be satisfied with.
DONE: Many characters have been made, or at least have a sketch of what they roughly are.
DOING: The current task is writing the story (or history), and to decide how the story is told.
TO-DO: In what form the final product is presented has not been decided yet.

\* This article is a work-in-progress. It will be gradually expanded into a fully-fledged information portal.

h2. External links
* English: "Lore page on Tyson Tan's website":[https://tysontan.com/electric-hearts-top/]
* 中文: "钛山的个人网站的设定页面":[https://tai3.cn/electric-hearts-top/]
* "DeviantArt: Electric Hearts":[https://www.deviantart.com/tysontan/journal/Electric-Hearts-695688174]

title: spirit_animals_in_disguise
body:
[b]Spirit Animals in Disguise[/b] is a fantasy project created by [[Tyson Tan]].
[b]千变灵兽[/b]是[[Tyson Tan|钛山]]创作的玄幻项目。

h2. Featured/作品精选
* !post #9096739
* !post #9096803
* !post #9096827
* !post #9096843

h2.Lore/设定
English: "Lore page on Tyson Tan's website":[https://tysontan.com/spirit-animals-top/]
中文: "钛山的个人网站的设定页面":[https://tai3.cn/spirit-animals-top/]

h2.Introduction

Follow the perspective of [[Leiting the Spirit Loong|Ao Leiting]], a human girl who accidentally becomes a spirit loong. Discover how spirit animals live among humans in disguise, and how the kids uncover the historic roots of traditional folklore.

* Spirit animals in human, anthro, and animal forms
* Limited abilities and rich world building
* Everyday life-focused stories and plots

[b]Note: [/b]Spirit Animals in Disguise is set in the same universe as [[Electric Hearts]].

h2.简介

本作品跟随意外变为灵龙的人类少女[[Leiting the Spirit Loong|傲雷婷]]的视角，讲述灵兽们在人类社会中隐匿真实身份生活的趣事，并和他们一起发现传统神怪传说的历史脉络。

* 灵兽具备人类、兽人、动物三种形态
* 有限且克制的特殊能力与详实的设定
* 日常生活主导的剧情

[b]提示：[/b]本作品与钛山的另一个作品“[[Electric Hearts|电子之心]]”共享世界观。

title: murano_sayaka
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 103rd graduating class. 

She is clumsy, but is also a genuine hard worker. She also does [[figure skating]]; getting better at it was her initial motivation for becoming a school idol. In her third year, she acts as co-president of the School Idol Club along with [[Hinoshita Kaho]].

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]]. Her hair in her first two years is usually tied with [[blue ribbon|blue]] [[hair ribbon|ribbons]] in [[low twintails]]. In her third and final year, she has it in a [[half updo]] tied with two ribbons, one blue and one [[red ribbon|red]], and a [[star hair ornament]], all located at the back of her head. She also has a [[mole on neck|mole on her neck]].

She typically wears her [[winter uniform|winter]] [[hasu no sora school uniform|uniform]] with an [[open cardigan|open]] [[brown cardigan|brown]] [[cardigan]].

Voiced by [[Nonaka Kokona]].

title: hinoshita_kaho
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 103rd graduating class. 

An extremely energetic girl, she enrolled into the academy in order to "bloom". In her third year, she acts as co-president of the School Idol Club along with [[Murano Sayaka]].

She has [[aqua eyes]] (sometimes depicted [[green eyes|green]]) and [[medium hair|medium]] [[orange hair]]. Her hair is usually styled with [[crossed bangs]], side ahoge-like [[two side up]], and [[rabbit hair ornament|rabbit hair ornaments]] on either side of her face.

Voiced by [[Nirei Nozomi]].

title: cross_(xenoblade_x)
body:
The customizable main character of [[Xenoblade Chronicles X]].

Contrary to popular belief, Cross is not the official name for the avatar. The avatar does not have a default name in Japanese, English, and other languages. The name "Cross" was used once in a Japanese footage from the Nintendo Direct aired on November 5, 2014. A fan translator mistook it as the official name for the avatar. This name was used again in the Japanese footage of the second trailer for Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition, while the name "Ryan" was used in the English footage.

The [[cross (male) (xenoblade_x)|default male]] has red-brown hair with a prominent cowlick, and the [[cross (female) (xenoblade x)|default female]] has black hair tied into medium twintails; however, unlike many comparably customizable protagonists, Cross's defaults are not particularly iconic, and most art of them is instead the artist's or commissioner's [[original]] character wearing in-game armor options.

title: wind_of_purity_(infinity_nikki)
body:
A 4-star Ability Outfit featured in [[Infinity Nikki]]. In gameplay, it is used by [[nikki_(nikki)|Nikki]] to shoot energy blasts to fight enemies and collect essences. It can be acquired for free by playing through the main story.

The outfit includes a [[white_dress|white]] [[halter dress]] which fades to green around the skirt and has ribbons trailing from the back, [[detached_sleeves|detached]] [[puffy long sleeves]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[high heel sandals|high heel]] [[cross-laced sandals]]. The hairstyle for this outfit is [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[low-braided long hair]]. Accessories for the outfit include a golden headband of branches and flowers, resmebling a [[laurel crown]], and a pair of golden [[crescent earrings|crescent moon earrings]].

It has an alternate color evolution with a white dress that fades to blue, and black hair.

title: heart_ahoge
body:
An instance of "expressive hair" where a character's [[ahoge]] (lock of hair that sticks up) bends to form a [[heart]], often to indicate that the owner is [[happy]] or in love. Distinct from [[heart antenna hair]], which is made from multiple ahoge.

body: Original character belonging to [[Keziedra]]

title: cordelia_herschel_(young)_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
Younger version of [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]]. Young mistress of an affluent household unravaged by the wars in the Mechanical Buddy Universe. Childhood 'friend' of the [[Shu (mechanical buddy universe)|]], and the one responsible for picking her up and pressing her into her service.

She is given the name "Cordelia Herschel" (コーディリア・ハーシェル) in the serialized manga "Mechanical Buddy Universe 1.0".

[spoiler]Posthumous character. The current [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]] is her robotic body double. In later chapters, proven to be the creator of [[Cordelia herschel (mechanical buddy universe)|]].[/spoiler]

title: diva_duo_(mechanical_buddy_universe)
body:
'Quadrupedal' AugMech exclusively used by members of the Banshee Squad from "The Banshee Cometh (Ishiyumi)":[/pools/17015]. [[Dahlia (mechanical Buddy Universe)|Banshee Sister]]'s personal mech is a command variant of the same.

"Wears" a distinctive mech-sized tattered hooded cloak in most of its appearances.

title: hanae_(cheer_squad)_(blue_archive)
body:
The [[cheerleader]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Hanae (blue archive)|]]. Current unplayable.

It consists of a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[visor cap]] a [[blue shirt|blue]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[sailor shirt]] [[crop top]] with a [[white sailor collar]], a [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated_skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] with a [[waist bow]], [[mismatched legwear|mismatched]] [[white thighhighs]] with one being one being [[frilled thighhighs|frilled]] and [[ribbon-trimmed legwear|ribbon-trimmed]] and [[blue shoes|blue]] [[high tops]]. She also carries yellow [[pom pom (cheerleading)|]]s.

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, her [[long hair]] is tied in a [[two side up]] with [[swept bangs]], decorated with an [[x hair ornament]]. She also has a [[heart sticker|heart sticker]] [[sticker on face|on her face]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #23215135: Profile

title: honkai:_star_rail
body:
A turn-based Chinese video game developed by [[miHoYo]]. The game is a spin-off to the [[Honkai (series)|]] series. Released on April 26, 2023.

The player takes the role of the [[Trailblazer (honkai: star rail)|]], a mysterious individual who boarded the [[Astral Express (honkai: star rail)|]] space train, and their journey across the universe.

title: kamen_rider_bake
body: The Rider form of [spoilers][[Suga Kenzo]][/spoilers].

title: itasha_(boonboomger)
body:
A character and one of the major antagonists from [[Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger]].

She, [[Decotrade]] and [[Yarucar]] make up the Hashilien sub-group the Sanseaters.

Most notably, she is voiced by popular [[voice actor|voice actress]] and [[singer]], [[Mizuki Nana]].

title: shifuto_mira
body: A woman who's constantly shifting from job to job. She joins the Boonboomgers as [[Bun Pink]].

title: bureki_genba
body: A procurer who works with the Boonboomgers, eventually joining them as [[Bun Orange]]. [spoilers]Genba was originally [b]Genbard De Livery II[/b], escaping from his home Planet Bureki after the Hashilens took it over.[/spoilers]

title: akuse_jou
body: A police officer who joins the Boonboomgers as [[Bun Black]].

title: inoue_shouma
body: The protagonist of [[Kamen Rider Gavv (series)|]]. Half-human and half-Granute, Shoma escapes to the human world, pursued by the Stomach Company, an organization selling addictive sweets run by his half-siblings, the Stomach Family. Due to his unique biology, Shoma has a red Gavv, which allows him to create [[Gochizo|Gochizos]] and transform into [[Kamen Rider Gavv]].
other_names: ショウマ・ストマック

title: suga_kenzo
body: A human researcher studying Granutes from [[Kamen Rider Gavv]]. He is secretly allied with the Stomach family's scientist, Nylev. Suga is responsible for creating the Valenbuster and performing the surgery on [[Karakida Hanto]] which allowed him to transform into [[Kamen Rider Valen]]. Using his research into Granutes, [spoilers]he creates the Bitter Gavvs, evil clones of [[Inoue Shouma|Shouma]], as well as finding a way to transform himself into [[Kamen Rider Bake]].[/spoilers]

title: hoshi_ryouko
body: The female deuteragonist of [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]. She is [[Yullian]]'s human form.

title: voices_of_the_void
body:
[b]Voices of the Void[/b] is an ambient horror survival game with sandbox game elements inspired by Signal Simulator.
Visuals, physics and sound effects play homage to [[Valve Software|Valve's]] Source Engine, though the game itself is made with the [[Unreal Engine (medium)|]].

h4. External Links

* Itch.io:https://mrdrnose.itch.io/votv
* Wiki:https://voicesofthevoid.wiki.gg/

title: aladdin_(movie)
body:
[i]Aladdin[/i] is a 1992 animated film produced by [[Disney]], based on the Arab folktale [i]Aladdin and the Magic Lamp[/i] from [[arabian_nights|One Thousand and One Nights]]. The film's success led to a franchise that included two direct-to-video sequel films, a TV series, various video games (with Virgin Games' Sega Genesis/Mega Drive game and Capcom's Super Nintendo game both garnering praise among gamers), a few theme park attractions, and a Broadway musical.

h4. Characters

title: fa_mulan_(disney)
body: The protagonist of [[Mulan (movie)|]]. She is voiced by Ming-Na Wen who continues to voice the character in other animated Disney shows while in the 2020 live action Mulan film, she is played by Yifei Liu.

title: mulan_(movie)
body:
Mulan is a 1998 animated film produced by [[Disney]] based on the Chinese legend of Hua Mulan. The film takes place during the Han dynasty, where [[Fa Mulan (disney)|Fa Mulan]], daughter of aged warrior Fa Zhou, impersonates a man to take her father's place during a general conscription to counter a Hun invasion.

h4. External links

* "Mulan (1998 film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mulan_(1998_film)]

title: eimi_isami
body:
[[Hamster girl]] [[virtual YouTuber]] from [[Phase Connect]]'s third generation, Euphoria.

h4. Appearance
[tn]See post #7071189 for reference sheet.[/tn]
She is a [[hamster girl]] with [[curly hair|curly]] [[orange hair]], [[pink eyes]] and [[small breasts]].

Her default costume consists of a loose-fitting [[lab coat]] with attached [[ID card]] over a [[black shirt|black]]-[[two-tone shirt|and]]-[[white shirt|white]] [[crop top]] with an [[orange ribbon]], a [[black skirt]] and [[white footwear|white]] [[sneakers]] with [[loose socks|baggy]] [[kneehighs|knee-high]] [[white socks]]. She also has [[bandaid on leg|bandaids on her right knee and left thigh]].

Her default hairstyle is a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]] with a [[high ponytail]] tied with a [[black scrunchie]].

h4. External links
* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/@eimiisami]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/eimiisami]

title: hobby_hizack
body:
A fictional giant manned robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It first appeared in [[Char's Counterattack]].

[b]RMS-116H Hobby Hizack[/b]

An unarmed civilian version of the old [[Hizack]] military [[mobile suit]] used by the [[titans_(gundam)|Earth Federation Titans]] during [[zeta_gundam|The Gryps War]]. It is usually painted in bright, high visibility colors (blue, yellow, white and red).

title: tag_group:verbs_and_gerunds
body:
This tag group defines and sorts action-related tags according to their definition as a verb or a gerund. There is often debate regarding what tags should be used as a verb or a gerund, so this page should hopefully clear up any disambiguation. If there are any alias or implication changes made to a verb or gerund tag, it should be updated here as well.

h4.Verbs

Refers to a "finite verb":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finite_verb conveying an action, an occurrence, or a state of being (with the verb [i]to be[/i]). It is very difficult to write a complete sentence without using a verb in the English language. They can be written in three different tenses; past, present and future. On Danbooru, [b]they are written in "present participle":http://www.edufind.com/english/grammar/present_participle.php to denote that a character is doing something at that moment in the image.[/b] The action might be a freeze frame for us (unless it's an animated image), but it is occurring for them in the present and should be tagged as such. A lot of verbs are written in the present tense for this reason, many ending with -ing. If you can also call that verb an object, it should be listed in the gerunds category. This group is for words that can only possibly be treated as an action.

h4.Gerunds

For Danbooru's purposes, a gerund is a "non-finite verb":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Non-finite_verb that can also function as a noun. A verb written in -ing form can be turned into a subject or noun depending on how the sentence is structured. For instance, let's use the sentence, "Tagging images on Danbooru helps to narrow down a search". The gerund here is [i]tagging[/i] because it is being treated as the subject rather than the action; the actual verb here is [i]helps[/i] because it is describing how useful tagging is.

As stated above, and mainly for this site, an -ing verb can also refer to an actual object, not just a verb being turned into a subject. Examples including [i]building[/i] (the act of constructing something vs. the actual structure itself), [i]drawing[/i] (the act of doodling on paper vs. the completed picture itself), or [i]wedding[/i] (the act of being wed vs. the ceremony). [b]If you're able to call an -ing word both a verb and a noun, it should fall under this list as a gerund.[/b] Many of these gerunds already have the -ing verb aliased to them, and their wikis often have the phrases, "As a verb, it is the act of..." followed by, "As a noun..." to clarify the term both as an action and an object.

body:

May be stored in a [[diploma tube|tube]] or [[diploma folder|folder]] for storage or easier handling, or be put in a [[picture frame|frame]] to be decorated on the wall.

title: astonaige_medoz
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] series. He first appeared in the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985. Also appears in the sequel TV series [[Gundam ZZ]] (1986) and the anime film [[Char's Counterattack]] (1988).

[b]Astoinage Medoz[/b] is the chief [[Mobile Suit]] mechanic of the AEUG [[Argama]] and [[Nahel Argama]]  [[military]] [[spacecraft]]. 

He later becomes part of the [[earth_federation_space_forces|Londo Bell fleet]] and the chief MS mechanic in the [[Ra Cailum]] spacecraft, where he starts a relationship with MS pilot [[Kayra Su]]. [spoiler]He died during the final battle of the Second [[Neo Zeon]] War when a stray [[Geara Doga]] [[beam rifle]] shot hit him while attending MS units at the ship's launch pad.[/spoiler]
other_names: アストナージ・メドッソ

title: kayra_su
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. She first appeared in the [[Char's Counterattack]] anime film from 1988.

[b]Kayra Su[/b] is a blonde [[Earth Federation Space Forces]] [[mobile_suit|MS]] pilot. Kayra is in a relationship with MS mechanic [[Astonaige Medoz]].

title: lady_battlecop_(character)
body:
[b]Lady BattleCop[/b] (女バトルコップ, [i]Onna BatoruKoppu[/i]) is the main protagonist of the [[cyberpunk]] [[lady_battlecop|film of the same name]], portrayed by [[Japan]]ese actress and former professional tennis player [[Nakamura Azusa]].

She is a heavy armored and armed [[cyborg]]. 

Her design was heavily influenced by [[Robocop (character)]].

title: lady_battlecop
body:
[b][i]Lady BattleCop[/i][/b] is a Japanese [[science fiction]] and [[cyberpunk]] [[tokusatsu]] film directed by Okamoto Akihisa and starring actress [[Nakamura Azusa]]. It was released in November 9, 1990 in Japan.

The film was heavily influenced by [[RoboCop]], released in the USA 3 years before.

h4. See also

* [[Lady BattleCop (character)]]

title: nakamura_azusa
body:
Former [[Japan]]ese TV and film actress, TV presenter and professional tennis player. A very attractive and popular [[Television]] personality due to her neat looks, she acted in several TV dramas during the 90s and retired from the entertainment industry in 1998 after marrying a wealthy business man.

Plays [[lady_battlecop_(character)|the titular character]] in the 1990 [[science fiction]] film [[Lady BattleCop]].

h4.External links
* "My Drama List section":https://mydramalist.com/people/77049-nakamura-azusa

title: third-party_edit
body:
An image that has been edited by someone other than the artist (a third party).

Third-party edits are generally against the [[help:upload rules|upload rules]] and should not be uploaded. This includes:

* [[nude filter]]s
* [[headshop]]s
* [[fake translation]]s
* [[third-party watermark]]s
* Fanmade meme or joke edits
* Removal of artist signatures or watermarks
* Anything else that substantially alters the content of the image

Minor edits that don't substantially alter the content of the image may be allowed under specific circumstances. This includes posts that have been [[stitched]], [[colorized]], [[cleaned]], [[detexted]] or slightly [[cropped]].

h4. See also
* [[Second-party edit]] - a second party (such as the [[commission]]er or anyone with the artist's permission) is involved in editing the image.
* [[Photoshop (medium)]] - apply this tag when Adobe Photoshop is actually used by the artist to create an image
* [[help:upload rules]]

title: zaku_ii_hmt_johnny_ridden_custom
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It appears in [[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]].

[b]MS-06R-2 Zaku II High Mobility Type (Johnny Ridden Custom)[/b]

An updated High Mobility Type for the [[Zaku II]] [[mobile suit]]. The R-2 had vastly more powerful foot thrusters compared to the preceding R-1 and R-1A, and was sometimes referred to as "a [[Gelgoog]] in Zaku's clothing." It was extremely hard to control, and therefore only the most skilled pilots, like the Crimson Lightning, [[Johnny Ridden]], could control the type. 

It didn't help that Ridden's unit was painted in bright red, which almost always resulted in him being mistaken for the Red Comet, [[Char Aznable]] - however, at closer inspection, Ridden's colors are a deeper shade of red with black accents and yellow shoulder spikes, and the feet have longer covers over the added thrusters.

title: johnny_ridden
body:
A fictional character from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. He appears in [[MSV-R: The Return of Johnny Ridden]].

He is a legendary [[Zeon]] [[mobile suit]] ace pilot from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]].

His MS of choice is the [[Zaku II HMT Johnny Ridden Custom]].

title: zaku_mariner
body:
Fictional manned giant combat robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]RMS-192M Zaku Mariner[/b]

The [[Earth Federation]]'s production-line version of the Principality of [[Zeon]]'s MS-06M (MSM-01) [[Zaku Marine Type]] M-1 Prototype which was tested during [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. 

Ironically, the EFF was never able to use these suits as they were captured by [[Neo Zeon]] during [[gundam_zz|The First Neo Zeon War]], when their forces invaded Earth in U.C. 0088. A team of Zaku Mariners were used on an attack on the [[Argama]] after the ship had descended to Earth.

In U.C. 0096, two Zaku Mariners were used by the Zeon Remnants during their [[gundam_unicorn|Attack on the Federation's Torrington Base]].

title: chaldea_boys_collection
body:
An annual [[White Day]] event in [[Fate/Grand Order]] focusing on male (and [[1other|other]]) servants, with new [[craft essence (fate)|]]s and special gacha banners. Depending on the year, this coincides with the release of a new servant or an [[official alternate costume]] for an existing servant. Many craft essences from year to year take place within shared settings, the most notable being the Detective Edmond series (localized as The Dantès Files). Starting in 2019, a limited-time event with story featuring the focus servant would be released alongside the craft essences. Starting in 2022, the craft essences would receive voice lines. h4.
