title: zssa
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] TV series from 1986.

[b]AMX-102 Zssa[/b]

Small artillery type [[mobile_suit|MS]] created by [[Neo Zeon]]. As it was supposed to work in tandem with the close-quarters type [[Galluss-J]], it was loaded to the utter brim with [[missile]]s, guns and all sorts of extra ranged armament, serving as support. 

However, the Zssa was severely lacking in the melee combat area, so it required obligatory escort from raid capable [[mecha]] for each of its missions.

title: official_art
body:
Artwork that is made by the official company/artist of a series or character. May have the [[copyright name|copyright]], [[company name|company]], or [[artist name|artist]] names emblazoned somewhere on the picture, as well as a [[copyright notice]].

Not to be confused with [[official style]], which is when an unofficial art tries to imitate the art style used in official arts.

h4. See also

* [[guest art]]
* [[concept art]]
* [[production art]]

title: full_frontal
body:
The main antagonist of [[Gundam Unicorn|Mobile Suit Gundam Unicorn]]. He is the mysterious leader of the [[Neo Zeon]] remnant forces "The Sleeves" and pilots his own custom [[mobile suit]], the [[Sinanju]]. 

[spoilers]A powerful Newtype implied to be a clone of [[Char Aznable]], after being defeated by [[Banagher Links]] in his [[Unicorn Gundam]], Full Frontall's/Char spirit abandons his body (which becomes an empty dead husk) and joins the spirits of both [[Amuro Ray]] and [[Lalah Sune]] who welcome him back in their travel towards the afterlife.[/spoilers]

Not to be confused with the slang "going full frontal", otherwise tagged as [[completely nude]].

h4.See also
* [[straight-on]] - An image whose subject is directly facing the viewer at a 0° angle.

title: nemo_iii
body:
A fictional manned giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]MSA-004K Nemo III[/b]

A further development of the failed [[Nemo II]] prototype [[mobile suit]], repurposed as a long range fire support unit with the addition of an over-the-shoulder [[beam cannon]].

title: revision
body:
An image that has been altered by the artist to make corrections to it. The changes may be minor (such as a missing mole) or they may be major (correcting for bad proportions, or adding censorship).

This tag should not be used unless there is a visual difference between the images. Images that differ only in resolution or compression level are [[duplicate]]s, not revisions.

It also should not be used if the original non-revised image doesn't exist on Danbooru.

If a post was completely redrawn, use [[redrawn]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[md5 mismatch]]
* [[duplicate]]
* [[has bad revision]] (for when a revision is available, but it is inferior to the image already on Danbooru)
* [[has censored revision]] (for when a revision is available, but has been censored, most likely due to the artist accidentally posting an uncensored version)
* [[variant_set]]
* [[unfinished]]

title: ass_smack
body:
Ass smacking is when someone is smacking the ass of another person, usually using their hand or some other method.

Sometimes it is used to show disapproval or anger towards the victim of the ass smack, however it can also be used in a erotic manner such as invitation for sex. Can also be used for comedic effect.

Ass smacking typically consists of a single playful slap, in cases where there are multiple rough and painful slaps use the [[spanking]] tag instead.

h4. Examples of ass smack

* !post #7469410
* !post #6388730

h4. Example of spanking

* !post #5566031

h4. See also

* [[slapping]]
* [[spanking]]
* [[spanked]]
* [[slap mark]]

title: short_sidetail
body:
A variation of [[side ponytail]], similar to [[short ponytail]], where the gathered hair is notably shorter than normal. Usually stops halfway between the top of the head and the chin.

Not to be confused with [[one side up]], which also has hair tied on the side but it lets some hair fall loosely. In a [[side ponytail]] the majority of one's hair—save for [[sidelocks]]—is pulled up into a ponytail that leaves [b]no[/b] hair falling loosely.

h4. Examples

* !post #6774705
* !post #7269091

h4. Non examples

* !post #6414776: short hair, short [[one side up|side up]]
* !post #6431000: long hair, short [[one side up|side up]]
* !post #9077757: long side ponytail

h4. See also

* [[side ponytail]]
* [[low side ponytail]]
* [[high side ponytail]]

title: donkey_kong_64
body:
The [[Donkey Kong_(series)|]] franchise's first 3D adventure platformer, released in 1999 on the [[Nintendo 64]]. 

The Kongs must race against time to stop [[King K. Rool]] from using his doomsday weapon, the Blast-o-Matic, from destroying DK Isles.

Along with [[Donkey Kong]] and [[Diddy Kong]] a new lineup of playable Kongs are added: [[Lanky Kong]], [[Tiny Kong]] and [[Chunky Kong]].

title: one-hour_drawing_challenge
body:
The [b]Late Night Serious 60-Minute Drawing Game[/b] (深夜の真剣お絵描き60分一本勝負, Shin'ya no Shinken Oekaki 60-bu Ipponshōbu), or [b]1draw[/b] (ワンドロ, Wandoro), is a self-explanatory Twitter hashtag where artists are given a prompt and have an hour to exercise their skills.

The prompt is usually composed of three characters from a set copyright. Each copyright gets their own tag.

The challenge was originally started on May 13, 2013, by twitter user [[monyomoke]], establishing a prompt where participants were to draw [[Touhou]] characters [[komeiji_koishi|Koishi]], [[Nazrin]], and/or [[ibaraki_Kasen|Kasen]]. After a couple months, however, the organizer decided to quit, since he was tired. The role of organizer has since been passed over a couple of times.

The Touhou prompt is currently being hosted by "@1draw_night":[https://twitter.com/1draw_night]. They also have "a website":[http://1draw.aqn.jp] which hosts the artworks posted at the hashtag, with the artists' permission.

Other accounts dealing with different copyrights have been appearing. Some tags may be defunct.

h4. External links

* "Nameless Rumia's Wiki: 1draw":[https://namelessrumia.heliohost.org/w/doku.php?id=1draw]

title: die_umarmung_(gustav_klimt)
body:
A painting by the Austrian painter Gustav Klimt, painted between 1905 and 1909 as part of the Stoclet Freize series of murals. Also known as [i]The Embrace[/i] or [i]Fulfillment[/i].

Like [[The Kiss]], Die Emarmung was one of the paintings referenced in [[Elfen Lied]]'s opening.

title: assassin_(fate/zero)
body:
The Servant of [[Kotomine Kirei]] in the 4th Holy Grail War. His unique trait is the capability to manifest as multiple entities at once.

The multiple bodies of Assassin can vary widely in [[child assassin (fate/zero)|age]], [[female assassin (fate/zero)|gender]], build, and style of dress, but in general, their hair appears purple, and their skin and clothing are nearly black. They wear the standard skull mask associated with the known Hassan of the other Grail Wars. Their unique sobriquet among the Hassan is "of the Hundred Faces".

Not to be mistaken with [[Sasaki Kojirou (fate)|Assassin (Fate/stay night)]].

[b]True Name:[/b] Hassan-i-Sabbah

title: takamiya_mio
body:
She is a character from [[Date a Live]] series.

As [[Takamiya Mana]]'s memories were starting to flash before her like a camera shutter, she managed to catch a glimpse of Mio's appearance, describing her as a girl with long hair. 

[spoiler]She is The First Spirit to make an appearance on 30 years before the beginning of the events in Date A Live, also known as the Spirit of Origin. She was summoned into the world by Sir Isaac Ray Pelham Westcott, [[Ellen Mira Mathers]], and Elliot Baldwin Woodman through the Spirit Formula gathering all the world's mana into a single point. However, her birth also caused the first spacequake in history at some point of the frontier between China and Mongolia, killing over 150 million people and starting a chain of similar disasters around the world that would last approximately six months.
[/spoiler]
[spoiler]It is revealed that Mio's doppelganger is [[Murasame Reine]].[/spoiler]

h4. External Links
* "Date A Live Wiki: Mio Takamiya":https://date-a-live.fandom.com/wiki/Mio_Takamiya

title: luke_sullivan
body:
A character from [[Street Fighter]] series, first debuted as the last DLC characters in [[Street Fighter V]] and serving as one of the main protagonist in [[Street Fighter 6]].

While he was still young, Luke lost his father Robert after the latter sacrifice himself in protecting civilians from terrorist attack. Inspired by his father's deeds, Luke joined the [[United States Army]] under [[Guile]]'s supervision. Feeling that military life is not fit for him, Luke resigned from the army and began his career as an PMC contractor and later an MMA coach.

A brash, hot-blooded, yet righteous character. Luke was designed to appeal the "new generation" of players by depicting him enjoying various hobby and modern culture, including playing video games. He is also depicted as a rival to the fellow hot-blooded fighter [[Jamie Siu]] since their childhood.

Luke's initial reception by fans were mixed-to-negative, as he was set up by [[Capcom]] to succeed [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] as the new leading cast of the franchise, though his popularity gradually improves, partly due to his English voice actor, Aleks Le, who has done various [[meme]] and shitposting video about him using his Luke character and often interact with the fanbase in various Luke-related tweets.

h5. Official bio

A contractor for a PMC, Luke uses his elite military background to teach mixed martial arts. His days off are spent eating junk food, playing PC video games, and fighting, but make no mistake—Luke plays to win.

* [b]Hates:[/b] Terrorism, horror games
* [b]Likes:[/b] Travelling, PC games, wacky T-shirts, his late father
* [b]Height:[/b] 185cm / 6'1 
* [b]Weight:[/b] 90kg / 198 lbs

title: ryu_(street_fighter)
body:
[i]You must defeat Sheng Long to stand a chance.[/i]
--Ryu, American version of [[Street Fighter II (series)|Street Fighter II]]
[tn]Mistranslation of the win quote, 昇龍拳を破らぬ限り、お前に勝ち目はない! ([i]lit.[/i] "If you cannot overcome the Shouryuuken, you don't stand a chance!) 
[/tn]

[b]Ryu[/b] is the main character and protagonist of the [[Street Fighter]] series. Ryu has made an appearance in every Street Fighter game, as well as in every crossover game with Capcom characters in it. Ryu has become a very famous character in the fighting genre, and is the star of the original Street Fighter.

As a very young child, Ryu was orphaned and left with no memories about his parents, and whether they were still alive. He was found and adopted by a man named [[Gouken]] who raised Ryu in his secluded dojo and trained Ryu in the ways of his martial arts. Shortly afterwards, Gouken would later train his best friend's spoiled son, [[Ken Masters]]. Ken served not only as a sparring partner, but also gave Ryu a friend in the form of a boy his own age.

Ryu looked up to Gouken as a father figure, and regards Ken as his best friend and surrogate brother, a relationship which remains to this day. When Ryu was 23 years old, Gouken believed that Ryu was ready to travel the world in order to test and hone his martial skills against the best fighters from around the world. With this, Ryu left Gouken's dojo, and headed to fight in the World Warrior tournament.

h4. Appearance

* !post #234921: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #7532479: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #1278526: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309889: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2037003: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6360628: [[Street Fighter 6]]

In most of his appearances, Ryu has [[short hair|short]] dark [[brown hair]] (sometimes depicted as [[black hair|black]] instead) tied with a [[red headband]]. He wears a white [[dougi]] with [[torn sleeves]] and red [[fingerless gloves]], and is usually [[barefoot]]. In his appearance in [i][[Street Fighter 6]][/i], he has grown a [[beard]] and forgone the upper portion of his dougi for a reddish-brown [[sash]].

h4. Known moves

* [[Hadouken]] (波動拳)
** Shakunetsu Hadouken (灼熱波動拳)
** Shinkuu Hadouken (真空波動拳)
** Denjin Hadouken (電刃波動拳)
** Metsu Hadouken (滅波動拳)

* [[Shouryuuken]] (昇龍拳)
** Shin Shouryuuken (真・昇龍拳)
** Metsu Shouryuuken (滅・昇龍拳)

* [[Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku]] (竜巻旋風脚)
** Shinkuu Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (真空竜巻旋風脚)

h4. Alternate forms

* [[Evil Ryu]]
* [[Kagenarumono]]
* [[Crimson Hawk Ranger]]

title: annytf
body:
[[anyuu]]'s [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] avatar. Debuted on [[twitch.tv|Twitch]] February 22, 2021, but has been active on Pixiv since late 2018.

A [[fox girl]] with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[yellow eyes]]. She has orange [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail]] with white [[animal ear fluff|fluff]], like that of an American red fox.

Her official outfit consists of a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[off shoulder]] [[crop top]] with a [[zipper]] on the front, and a [[striped camisole]] [[undershirt|underneath]], both of which reveal her [[midriff]] and [[cleavage]], as well as [[highleg panties]] under her [[shorts]]. Notably, she features a [[star hair ornament]] and [[choker]].

Gained added notability as she was commissioned by [[vedal987]] to be the artist and designer for [[Neuro-Sama]]'s second model. She has subsequently gone and done the design for Neuro's "sister" [[Evil Neuro-sama]].  Since then she has become a regular collaborator in Neuro's streams, where she has embraced being Neuro's "mom", and tones down her ecchiness during such collabs tremendously, to the point where her most often used outfit is a very form-concealing (but still cute) hoodie.

h4. External links

title: neuro-sama
body:
An English-speaking [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] entirely powered by artificial intelligence under [[Vedal AI]]. Created by osu! streamer [[Vedal987]], she can respond to chat messages using a large language model and play video games such as [[osu!]] and [[Minecraft]]. 
Illustrated by [[anyuu|annytf]].

Her gameplaying part is written in Python, while her chatbot part is written in C#.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]], and [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]] with an [[ahoge]], [[hair between eyes|hair between her eyes]] and [[two side up|two side ups]] held by [[red ribbon|red]] [[hair ribbon|hair ribbons]] and a [[heart hair ornament|heart-shaped]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[school uniform]]: a [[yellow cardigan|yellow]] [[v-neck]] [[off-shoulder cardigan]] with [[long sleeves]] reaching [[sleeves past wrists|past her wrists]], with an [[aqua bowtie]] over a [[serafuku]] with [[grey sailor collar|grey]] or [[blue sailor collar]] and a [[grey skirt|grey]] or [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]]; [[uneven legwear]] with a [[black thighhighs|black]] [[single thighhigh|thighhigh]], [[black socks|black]] [[single sock|kneehigh]] and a [[bandaid on knee|bandaid on her knee]]; and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. Her accessories include a [[red bag|red]] [[duffel bag|gymbag]] or [[shoulder bag]], and many [[button badge|button badges]] in the shapes of a heart, a star, a turtle, a drone and an osu! #1 badge.

title: evil_ryu
body:
[b]Evil Ryu[/b], whose full name is known as [b]Satsui no Hadou ni Mezameta Ryuu[/b] ([i]lit.[/i] "Ryu who has Awakened to the Surge of Killing Intent") or just [b]Satsui Ryu[/b] ([i]lit.[/i] "Murderous Ryu"), is a playable character in various [[Street Fighter]] games beginning with [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 2]]. He was originally introduced in a Street Fighter Zero manga series authored by [[Nakahira Masahiko]] and later adapted in the Street Fighter canon by [[Capcom]].

He is the version of [[Ryu (street fighter)|]] should he succumb to Satsui no Hadou, and depicts Ryu's struggle to resist the urge. Gameplay-wise, Evil Ryu has more powerful attacks than the original, strikes faster and possesses some of the attacks of [[Akuma (street fighter)|]]. The kanji 'Metsu' (滅) - meaning "destruction" - can be seen on his back when it appears after a Shun Goku Satsu finish.

h4. Known moves

* [[hadouken|Gou Hadouken]] (豪波動拳)
** Shakunetsu Hadouken (灼熱波動拳)
** Metsu Hadouken (滅波動拳)

* [[shouryuuken|Gou Shouryuuken]] (豪昇龍拳)
** Messatsu Gou Shouryuu (滅殺豪昇龍)

* Tatsumaki Senpuukyaku (竜巻旋風脚)

* Ryusokyaku

* Ashura Senku (阿修羅閃空)
** [[Shun Goku Satsu]] (瞬獄殺)
other_names: 殺意の波動に目覚めたリュウ

title: giant_of_light
body:
The species of [[giant]]s from the [[Ultra Series]], casually referred to as the [i]Ultra[/i] species, due to not having any official name. In lieu of that, they are often referred to as [i]Giants of Light[/i] in official media. They are sometimes also referred to as the [i]Residents of the [[Land of Light]][/i] (or Light-lander), or [i]Residents of the M78 Nebula[/i], but this can be ambiguous as the Ultras are not the only species there, and they can be found residing in other lands/nebulas/universes (ex. the Ultra People of Planet U40).

This tag is intended for depictions of Giants of Light that aren't any of the official Ultra characters, whether it be ersatz characters just referencing the series, or [[original]] Ultra characters.

They are depicted with skin that feature either silver, red or blue as their dominant color, and then either of the remaining two along with black or more as highlights, with their dominant color representing to which subspecies among the Ultra species they belong to. Every Giant's body bears unique markings/patterns and features which enables them to be distinguished from one another (this includes the various generic unique designs made for depicting the Light-landers, though some depictions have generic Ultras depicted as looking basically like [[Ultraman]]).

h4. External links

* Ultraman Wiki: "Residents of the Land of Light":[https://ultra.fandom.com/wiki/Residents_of_the_Land_of_Light]
other_names: オリジナルウルトラマン

body:

Following his debut, he became one of the most popular monsters in the [[Ultra Series]].

[spoiler]He's also known as the first monster to defeat [[Ultraman]], in their first fight.[/spoiler]

title: professor_shinonome
body: Professor Shinonome, in the manga and anime series [[Nichijou]], is a girl of pre-school age who is nevertheless a genius inventor. Her inventions include (but are not limited to) the fully sapient robot girl [[Shinonome Nano]], who lives with her as a big-sister figure and guardian, and the [[scarf]] worn by their cat [[Sakamoto (Nichijou)|Sakamoto-san]], which translates his meows into human speech.

title: odda_(arknights)
body:
[i]Odda, Messenger from Kazdel, bearing greetings from friends lost to time.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Kazdel[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]January 1[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Sarkaz[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]168 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]18 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A former member of Babel, now works as an informant and Messenger between Kazdel and Rhodes Island.

He is short and baby-faced, with a weaker constitution compared to other Sarkaz due to some injuries he sustained as a child.

His weapon of choice is a hammer repurposed from an engine cylinder of an abandoned vehicle. Both of this weapon and his name belonged to his mother, a doctor of Babel, which he inherited when she passed away.

His [[voice actor]]s are Asari Ryōta (Japanese), Yu Songtao (Chinese), Ry McKeand (English) and Han Man-joong (Korean). His illustrator is [[scorpion5050]].

h4. Skins
* !post #9095079: Default
* !post #9095087: Elite II
* !post #9095063: [[odda_(candy_strike)_(arknights)|Candy Strike]]

title: degenbrecher_(arknights)
body:
[i]Guard Operator Degenbrecher, forever stood behind you.[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]June 6[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Caprinae[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]182 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]25 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Formerly known as "Black Knight" who has an outstanding physical ability but unable to use Originium Arts, the three-time champion of the Kazimierz Major.

After she won the third match she was supposed to lose, she has become  a threat to the General Chamber of Commerce's interests,
only to be hired by [[silverash_(arknights)|Enciodes]], and become a bodyguard in Karlan Trading Co.
Joined Rhodes Island as an operator via indefinite contract.

Debut as the final boss in the side story [i]Break the Ice[/i], and become a playable character in the side story [i]The Rides to Lake Silbernherze[/i].

Her [[voice actor|voice actors]] are [[Takayama Minami]] (JP), Wu Di (CN-Mandarin), Nina-Mercedés Rühl (EN), and Lim Yoon-seon (KR). Her art designer is [[Ryuuzaki Ichi]].

h4. Skins

title: black_swan_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
Playable character from [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. 

A Memokeeper of the Garden of Revelation and Emanator of Fuli, the Aeon of Remembrance. Voiced by [[Nabatame Hitomi]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] light [[purple hair]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[skin tight]] [[purple dress]] with [[detached sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[black pantyhose]], [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]], and a purple [[veil]]. 

Currently lurking on the [[Astral Express (Honkai: Star Rail)|]].

title: mockingbird_(marvel)
body:
[b]Mockingbird[/b] is a fictional superhero from [[Marvel]] comics. Also known as Agent 19, Barbara "Bobbi" Morse is an agent of the fictional SHIELD agency who is skilled in using two staves in combat and is the ex-wife of [[Clint Barton]] aka, [[Hawkeye (marvel)|]].

In the [[Marvel Cinematic Universe]] tv series, [[Agents of Shield]], Mockingbird/Bobbi Morse is played by Adrianne Palicki. Unlike in the comics, Bobbi is not Clint's ex-wife but was once married to Lance Hunter, a former British commando. Strangely, in the Disney+ show [[Hawkeye (disney+)|]], Clint's wife, Laura Barton, who is portrayed by Linda Cardellini, is revealed in the season finale to be a former SHIELD agent codenamed Agent 19, Mockingbird's codename in the comics. It is currently unclear if this means that the MCU retcon Agents of Shield as non-canon with Laura being Mockingbird all along or that Laura was the previous Mockingbird before giving up her mantle and codename to Bobbi after marrying Clint.

title: cardcaptor_sakura_clear_card_arc
body:
The sequel to [[Cardcaptor Sakura]], written and illustrated by the manga group [[Clamp (circle)|]]. It focuses on [[Kinomoto Sakura]] in junior high school. The manga was serialized in Kodansha's Nakayoshi magazine between the July 2016 and January 2024 issues, with the chapters being collected in 16 volumes. A 22-episode anime television series adaptation produced by Madhouse, featuring the cast and staff from the original series, aired from January to June 2018, which loosely adapts the first 24 chapters.

Use this tag when the fanart has [[Yume no Tsue]], [[Shinomoto Akiho]],  [[Yuna D Kaito]] or [[Tomoeda middle school uniform]].

body:
The 5th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]].

It consists of a [[pink kimono|pink]] [[fur-trimmed kimono|fur-trimmed]] [[floral print|floral]] [[floral print kimono|print]] [[print kimono|kimono]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]] [[white socks|white]] [[tabi]] and [[pink sandals|pink]] [[okobo]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is [[long hair]] decorated with a [[tsumami kanzashi]] on one side and a [[tassel hair ornament]] with a small [[hair bow|bow]] and a [[hair flower|flower]] on the other.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7365012: Profile

title: ayunda_risu_(cyberpunk)
body:
The 4th/[[Cyberpunk]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/8103x/status/1585053541403889664].

It consists of a [[two-tone jacket|two tone]] and [[black jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[pink sleeves|pink]] [[raglan sleeves]] anda [[popped collar]], a [[black_shirt|black]] [[crop top|black crop]], [[chest harness]] with an [[underbust]] [[chest belt]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] a [[black pantyhose]] a [[thigh strap]] on left left leg and black [[leg ribbon|ribbon]] wrapped around her lower right leg and [[pink shoes|pink]] [[sneakers]]. She also has an optional [[pink-tinted eyewear|pink-tinted]] [[head-mounted display]] and a [[headset]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[short hair]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and [[streaked hair|streaks]]/[[colored tips]] decorated with a bateri charge indicator-shaped [[hairclip]] on one side and an [[x hair ornament|x-shaped]] one on the other.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7365011: Profile

title: ayunda_risu_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd/[[witch]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]].

It consists of a [[brown headwear|brown]] [[witch hat]] decorated with a [[hat belt|belt]] and [[hat flower|flowers]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[brown jacket]] with [[breast pocket]]s, [[three-quarter sleeves|sleeves past her elbows]] with noticeable [[sleeve cuffs]] and held together with [[gold chain]] [[aiguillette]]s, worn over a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with a [[black bowtie]] pinned with a [[red brooch]], [[white gloves]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[medium skirt]] consisting of [[brown skirt|brown]] outer layer and [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[black skirt]] underneath, [[black pantyhose]], and [[black boots|black]] [[ankle boots]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] is [[medium hair]] with [[short hair with long locks|long]] [[sidelocks]] with the same [[leaf hair ornament|leaf-shaped]] [[hairclip]] from her default costume.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4859150: Profile

title: ayunda_risu_(indonesian_casual)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Ayunda Risu]].

It is based on [[indonesian clothes|Indonesian]] fashion, consisting of a small [[straw hat]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[red jacket|red]] [[floral print|floral]] [[floral print jacket|print]] [[print jacket|jacket]] resembling a kebaya, worn over a [[long dress|long]] [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[floral print|floral]] [[floral print dress|print]] [[print dress|dress]] with a [[frilled dress|frilled]] section over her chest, a wide [[underbust]] [[black belt]] and [[brown sandals|brown]] [[gladiator sandals]] with [[footwear flower|flowers on them]]. She also wears a [[necklace]] with a [[food-themed necklace|walnut pendant]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume is [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair]] decorated with small [[hair flower]]s and a [[side braid]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7365010: Profile

title: narita_brian_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] Character. The resident "lone wolf" of the series and vice president of the Tracen Academy Student Council. While her tough, intimidating presence makes her difficult to approach, she is actually a patient listener who is very good with children.

She is a member of Team Rigil in the anime, and Team Sirius in the game.

title: houshou_marine_(nun)
body:
An [[alternate costume]] of [[hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]]. Originated from a fanart by [[Oshiruko (oshiruco 212048)|]] posted on the end of October 2021, which was later used by Marine herself for the use in her "sin confessions" stream. A [[revealing clothes|skimpy]] version of the costume also briefly appeared in her first confession stream.

The costume consists of a dark blue [[nun]] habit with white double triangular [[breast curtain]]s and a dark blue [[pelvic curtain]]. There are two "skimpy" versions of the outfit, one with the inner garments removed (including [[no bra|bra]] and [[no panties|panties]]) revealing the wearer's [[underboob]] and only has the aforementioned curtains to cover their private parts. The other "skimpy" version swaps the long pelvic curtain for an even shorter one covering the crotch, leaving the [[midriff]] exposed. On December 2022, a revised version of the original costume was revealed. This version of the costume differs by using the same hairstyle of her [[houshou marine (marching band)|band costume]] and the addition of a suggestive [[underboob cutout]] on the costume.
 
While this costume is technically unofficial (as it never received an official model for obvious reasons), it has gained notoriety within and out of the Hololive fanbase for its frequent usage by Marine herself, which resulted in it gaining the status of a [[meme attire]].

This tag is applicable to any posts that:
* Features Marine herself wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it, and not a generic [[nun]] outfit.
* Has other character(s) wearing any variant of the outfit or derivative of it. In this case, the tag [[Houshou Marine (cosplay)]] is applicable.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4880115: 1st version (normal)
* !post #4880121: 1st version (skimpy variant 1)
* !post #4882536: 1st version (skimpy variant 2)
* !post #5924061: 2nd version

h4. See also

* [[Houshou Marine (Ahoy!! You're All Pirates)|Ahoy!! You're All Pirates]] - an official costume using nun elements
other_names: 宝鐘マリン(シスター衣装)

title: kachimachi_kosuzu
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[DOLLCHESTRA]] from the 104th graduating class. 

She wants to find "something she can be proud of," as she feels she has no talent. This drives her to try many things to challenge herself. 

She has [[pink eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[brown hair]] styled in [[side braids]] tied behind her head with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bow]] and [[center-flap bangs]]. Often has a [[side ahoge]] off to her left.

Voiced by [[Hayama Fuka]].

title: meta_ridley
body:
[[Ridley]] as he appears in [i][[Metroid Prime]][/i], resuscitated and [[cyborg|cybernetically enhanced]] after his defeat in [[metroid_(classic)|Metroid]]/[[Metroid: Zero Mission]]. Much of his organics are replaced with machinery. 

His wings are now [[orange wings|orange]] or [[yellow wings|yellow]] and much of his body is covered in metal armor plating, from parts of his head to his neck all the way through his torso and tail. However parts of his arms and legs are still unprotected in armor and show organic skin covering. His [[orange eyes]] now [[glowing_eyes|glow]] more consistently compared to other iterations.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25482805: Original
* !asset #25482811: Remastered

title: momose_ginko
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Cerise Bouquet]] from the 104th graduating class. 

She is a girl who loves tradition. [[momose ginko's grandmother|Her grandmother]] was a member of the Performing Arts Club, which later became the School Idol Club. As a Kanazawa native, she sometimes slips into the [[kanazawaben|Kanazawa dialect]] out of surprise. She defaults to it when speaking with her family.

She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[green hair|green]]-ish [[black hair]] styled in a [[blunt ends|blunt]] [[bob cut]] and [[blunt bangs]] with a [[hair flower]] and [[flower knot]] on her left.

She wears [[black pantyhose]] with her [[hasu no sora school uniform|school uniform]].

Voiced by [[Sakurai Hina]].

title: ridley
body:
A recurring boss in the [[Metroid]] series, appearing in almost every Metroid game, often encountered towards the end of the game. He was the leader of the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s prior to [[Mother Brain]]'s ascension and responsible for leading the raid that orphaned [[Samus Aran]].

Ridley's appearance is similar to a skeletal pterodactyl with glowing eyes. Ridley is known for being very defiant and persistent; though Samus has killed him many times, he always finds a way to return, either through cloning or robotics.

title: impa
body:
A female recurring character in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. She is a descendant of the mysterious [[Sheikah]] tribe that has served the Royal Family of Hyrule for many generations, and is [[Princess Zelda]]'s personal attendant. She often aids Link in his quest by giving him useful information. Her depiction in each game has varied widely; from a withered old woman, to large, middle aged woman, to a lithe, young bodyguard.

In [[the_legend_of_zelda:_ocarina_of_time|Ocarina of Time]] and [[the_legend_of_zelda:_a_link_between_worlds|A Link Between Worlds]], she is the Sage of Shadows.

She returns as a playable character in the spin-off title [[Hyrule Warriors]], where she fights using a giant [[sword|blade]] and a [[naginata]]. Ironically, she is initially suspicious of [[Sheik]].

The Impa in [[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]] is the exact same Impa as the one in [[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath Of The Wild]], except a hundred years [[aged down|younger]]. This Impa is much closer to [[paya_(zelda)|Paya]], her future granddaughter, than to any previous versions of Impa, and [[look-alike|not just in looks]].

[expand=Appearances]

title: para-biddybud
body:
A winged variant of the [[Biddybud]] enemy in the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]]. In essence, these foes are small, colorful, ladybug‐like creatures that sport a pair of bird‑like wings, which give them the ability to fly rather than simply walking along the ground.

Para‐Biddybuds resemble multicolored ladybugs with wings. Unlike their non‑winged counterparts (Biddybuds), they move through the air in set patterns—often flying in circles, lines, or fixed vertical trajectories. They are typically encountered in groups and add an aerial element to the enemy lineup.

title: biddybuggy
body:
One of the karts used in the [[Mario Kart]] series. It made its debut in [[Mario Kart 8]] and later appeared in [[Mario Kart 8 Deluxe]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

The kart is designed in the likeness of a [[Para-Biddybud]]—a type of enemy that first appeared in [[Super Mario 3D Land]]. Its design features include a compact, buggy-like body with wing‐shaped exhaust pipes that animate (flap) when boosting.

title: standard_8_(mario)
body: A specific variant of the classic [[standard kart (mario)|Standard Kart]] design that originally appeared in [[Mario Kart 8]] and later re‐imagined as a distinct vehicle in [[Mario Kart Tour]]. In its original form in Mario Kart 8 (and its updated port, Mario Kart 8 Deluxe), the Standard Kart is the basic, well‐balanced racing vehicle that every racer can use without offering any particular advantages or drawbacks. Over time, however, this familiar design was reworked for other titles in the [[Mario Kart]] franchise.

body:

In the prequel [i][[Hyrule Warriors: Age Of Calamity]][/i], she is (apparently and actually) in her 20s.

In the sequel [i][[The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom]][/i], she again appears to be in her 20s like in [i]Age of Calamity[/i], but with a different outfit.

title: arknights
body:
A Chinese tower defense mobile game, developed by Hypergryph and published by Hypergryph (Simplified Chinese), Yostar (Japanese, Korean, Global) and Longcheng/Gryphline (Traditional Chinese). It is available in Google Playstore and iOS appstore.

The player is put in the role of the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]], in charge of [i]Rhodes Island[/i], an organization tasked with investigating disasters caused by a mysterious ore known as [[Originium (arknights)|]], and aiding those infected by [[Oripathy lesion (arknights)|Oripathy]], caused by exposure to Originium. As the amnesiac Doctor, the player is put in control over the characters known as Operators.

The game was first announced in 2017. Between 2017 and 2019, it was briefly available for several short beta tests. The game was officially released on May 1st, 2019. International versions in Japanese and English were released Jan. 16th, 2020. The game is available in its native Chinese, Japanese, English and Korean, each with their own app clients. For the first few years of the game's lifetime, character voices were only available in Japanese regardless of region; however, Mandarin character voices were added in September 2021, with dialectal Chinese voices for the Sui siblings added later, and English, Korean character voices along with Italian voices for Siracusian characters were added in 2022, Russian and German voices for characters from Ursus/Leithanien added in late 2023.

In 2022, a spinoff RPG game, [[Arknights: Endfield]], was announced.

title: ryougi_shiki
body:
Ryougi Shiki is one of the main protagonists of the [[Kara no Kyoukai]] novels. She is a teenage girl who possesses the [[Mystic Eyes of Death Perception]], a supernatural ability that allows the user to see the inherent mortality of everything (both living and non-living) in the form of lines.

She has short [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. She is usually seen wearing a [[red jacket|red]] [[leather jacket]] over a [[blue kimono]]. When she uses her powers, her eyes [[glowing eyes|glow]] an iridescent [[blue eyes|blue]] (though she is sometimes illustrated with blue eyes while [i]not[/i] using her powers [[artistic error|by mistake]]).

During the [[Fate/Grand Order]] collaboration event with Kara no Kyoukai, she can be acquired as an Assassin-class Servant. 

[spoiler]Her [[Void Shiki|third personality]] (aka the embodiment of the Void) can also be summoned as a Saber-class Servant. This version of hers wields the Kanesada Kuji, and as she gains power, her hair grows out, her kimono grows more elaborate, and has the Mystic Eyes of Death Perception activated permanently.[/spoiler]

[b]Character Design:[/b] [[Takeuchi Takashi]]
[b]Voice Actress:[/b] [[Sakamoto Maaya]]

title: toonami
body:
A programming block on the [[Cartoon Network]]/[[Adult Swim]] channel, geared towards airing action animation, generally manifesting itself in more action-oriented Western cartoons and, famously, anime. It originally ran from 1997 to 2008 on Cartoon Network, before a 2012 Adult Swim Toonami-themed April Fools would lead to the block being revived that same year, and running on Adult Swim ever since.

The block was originally hosted by the [[Space Ghost (series)|Space Ghost Coast to Coast]] incarnation of Moltar, before the [[Toonami Operations Module]], or TOM, debuted in 1999 to take over hosting responsibilities. TOM has switched bodies several times since his debut.

On Cartoon Network Japan, Toonami existed as a block from 2002 (during TOM 2's run) up to 2008 when it was cancelled around the same time as the US original was. TOM was subtitled in his appearances there. In 2018, for Adult Swim's April Fools, Toonami would partially air in Japanese, with TOM being voiced by Masa Kanome.

h4. Toonami/Warner anime co-productions in release order

body:

Hibiki became an idol in order to make everyone happy, and while competitive against the idols of [i]765[/i], she remains friendly, never becoming over-competitive. She is frequently pictured with her pets, most notably her hamster [[Hamuzou]] and dog [[Inumi]].

Hibiki is an idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy", along with ex-[i]765[/i] idol [[Hoshii Miki]] and [[Shijou Takane]].

title: voice_actor_connection
body:
A [[crossover]], [[cosplay]] or [[parody]] based on a character's [[voice actor]].

Most often, this is a character [[cosplay]]ing another character played by the same actor, or a [[crossover]] between multiple characters played by the same actor.

Other examples include:

* A character drawn with their voice actor.
* A voice actor cosplaying their own character.
* A character using mannerisms of their voice actor, or another character played by the same actor.
* A [[crossover]] between two characters played by related voice actors (by family or by marriage).
* A [[crossover]] between [[virtual youtuber]]s played by the same person.

When tagging the voice actor connection, please also tag the name of the [[voice actor]] referred to by the connection. Only include the [[voice actor]] tag if the actor him/herself is physically present in the image, or a character is cosplaying as the actor.

title: trait_connection
body:
A [[crossover]], [[cosplay]], or [[parody]] of two or more characters who have similar personality traits, or have similar circumstances occur to them in their respective stories. A comment explaining the connection would also be helpful in clarifying things to people unfamiliar with the characters.

h4. Examples

* !post #97077: [[Expressionless]] waifus
* !post #127032: [[Yandere]]s
* !post #195017: [[Tsundere]]s voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]]

title: stage_connection
body:
A tag use for pictures with groups of 3 or more same-stage/level bosses.

There are two ways to use this tag:

h6. From within a series

* The characters are from a single stage (ex: post #599038)
* The characters can be from multiple stage (Like 3 Stage 1 and 3 Stage 4) But cannot have one that's out of place (3 Stage 1 and 1 Stage 4) (ex: post #721271)
* In the case of comics, it should make a point of pointing out that's most of the bosses there. (ex: post #802620)

h6. For [[crossover]]

* When character A is a stage 1 boss from series A and character B is also a stage 1 boss of series B.

[i]Note: This tag can also be applied outside of [[Touhou]].[/i]

title: outfit_connection
body:
[[Crossover]] or [[cosplay]] of characters who share similar outfit designs, styles or themes.

This tag applies best on characters from different series but can be used for character from the same series as long as the designs aren't intentionally made similar for [[uniform]] or [[matching outfits]] purposes.

For design connections based on a specific accessory, use [[accessory connection]] instead.

h4. Examples

title: object_namesake
body:
A type of [[pun]] when a character is paired with any kind of object or animal that makes a reference to their civilian or alter ego's name. For instance, 'Yuri/百合' means '[[lily (flower)|lily]]', so a character named Yuri holding a bouquet of lilies would qualify.

h4. Examples

* any character named Ringo and an [[apple]] ("ringo" means apple)
* any character named Sakura and [[cherry blossoms]] ("sakura" means cherry blossom)
* [[Ibuki Suika]] and a [[watermelon]] or [[watermelon bar]] ("suika" means watermelon)
* [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and a [[patchouli_(plant)|patchouli]]
* any character named Raven and a black bird
* [[Tsubaki Yayoi]] and a [[camellia]] ("tsubaki" means camellia)
* [[BlazBlue]]'s [[Bullet (BlazBlue)|Bullet]] with an ammunition [[bullet]]
* any [[personification]] of an object depicted with the non-personified version of that object

title: look-alike
body:
Situation with two or more different characters whose physical attributes greatly resemble each other.

They can be from the same copyright, or from [[crossover|different copyrights]].

h5. Exceptions

These look-alikes should [b]not[/b] be tagged here.

* The same character appearing multiple times. Use [[dual persona]] or [[multiple persona]] instead.

title: hoshii_miki
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, introduced in the Xbox 360 version of the original [i]Idolmaster[/i] game.
A dyed-blonde 14-year-old idol from 961 Production's "Project Fairy" along with [[Ganaha Hibiki]] and [[Shijou Takane]], having defected from 765 Production (as of the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i]) due to her dissatisfaction with her handling. It is shown that Miki joins 765 Production, along with Hibiki and Takane, in the Idolmaster anime. Laid-back but brilliant, Miki is very popular with males, and believes in an easy way to becoming the top idol.

* !asset #25478293: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478315: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478397: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478470: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478433: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

h4. Stats 

* Birthday: November 23
* Horoscope: Sagittarius ♐
* Age: 14 → 15
* Height: 159cm → 161cm 
* Weight: 44kg → 45kg 
* BMI: 17.4 → 17.3
* Measurements: 84-55-82 → 86-55-83 
* Cup size: F
* Blood Type: B 
* Hobbies: Bird watching, talking with friends → talking with friends, nail art
* Seiyuu: [[Hasegawa Akiko]] 
* Theme color: light green (fresh green)

h4. See Also

* [[Awakened Miki]] - A hard-working version of Miki with short, brown hair.

body:
A joke, reference, or pairing based on two characters or things having the same or similar names. For example, a [[cosplay]] or [[crossover]] between two characters from different franchises having the same name.

Don't use for characters who share the same name because they're relatives, or for [[dual persona]] or alternate versions of the same character appearing in different titles. For namesakes based on animals or inanimate objects, use [[object namesake]] too.

title: minase_iori
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, Iori is the daughter of a CEO acquainted with 765 Production's president. Polite and refined to the audience, but sharp-tongued towards her fellow idols and Producer. Frequently found with her stuffed rabbit Usa-chan.

Not to be confused with the seiyuu [[Minase Inori]].

Voiced by [[Kugimiya Rie]].

* !asset #25478290: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478303: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478386: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478447: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478427: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

title: miura_azusa
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. Kind-hearted and ditzy, Azusa was motivated to become an idol in order to finally find a love interest. While easygoing, carefree and a "big sister" figure to the rest of 765's idols, she has a terrible sense of direction.

Voiced by [[Takahashi Chiaki]].

* !asset #25478289: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478302: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478384: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478446: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478426: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

title: akizuki_ritsuko
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. Originally an intern for 765 Production, but later promoted to idol due to lack of idols scouted. She hopes to become a producer herself, and in some games, actually is one. Her cousin [[akizuki ryo|Ryo]] appears in the DS game [i]Dearly Stars[/i] as an idol of 876 Production (and later in Side-M).

She has [[brown eyes]], wears [[glasses]], and her [[brown hair]] is often tied into [[twin braids]].

Voiced by [[Wakabayashi Naomi]].

* !asset #25478288: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478299: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478380: [[Idolmaster 2]]
* !asset #25478381: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478445: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478424: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

h4. See also

* "Akizuki Ritsuko on Project-iM@S Wiki":http://www.project-imas.wiki/Ritsuko_Akizuki

title: takatsuki_yayoi
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. As the eldest of five siblings, she became an idol for a living, even going so far as to perform other jobs besides her career. Even as she looks after her younger siblings, Yayoi herself yearns for an "older brother" figure to look after her.

Voiced by [[Nigo Mayako]].

* !asset #25478285: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478298: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478377: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478444: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478423: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

title: hagiwara_yukiho
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series, Yukiho aspires to become an idol in order to break out of her shell. Yukiho loves [[green tea]] and is an avid poetry writer, but is afraid of boys.

Voiced by [[Ochiai Yurika]] (alias Hase Yurina) for the first game, and [[Asakura Azumi]] for [i]Idolmaster 2[/i].

* !asset #25478284: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]
* !asset #25478297: [[Idolmaster SP]]
* !asset #25478374: [[Idolmaster One for All|One for All]]
* !asset #25478443: [[Idolmaster Platinum Stars|Platinum Stars]] / [[Idolmaster Stella Stage|Stella Stage]] / [[Idolmaster Starlit Season|Starlit Season]]
* !asset #25478422: [[Idolmaster Million Live! Theater Days|Theater Days]]

title: kisaragi_chihaya
body:
One of the main characters of the [[Idolmaster]] series. While naturally talented, Chihaya is less enthusiastic about the "idol" aspect of her career, preferring classical music, and is actually rather awkward with other people. Well-known for her occasional insecurity regarding her rather [[flat chest]].

Her mother is [[Kisaragi Chigusa]]. [spoiler]She also has a deceased younger brother, [[Kisaragi Yuu (idolmaster)|Kisaragi Yuu]].[/spoiler]

Voiced by [[Imai Asami]] and, in [[Idolmaster Xenoglossia]], [[Shimizu Kaori]].

* !asset #25478283: [[Idolmaster 1]] / [[Idolmaster Live for You!|Live for You!]]

title: grand_theft_auto_iv
body:
The tenth game of the [[Grand Theft Auto]] series, released in 2008. It marks the debut of the HD Universe, a separate timeline from its predecessors being the 3D Universe. The game is set in Liberty City but most of its islands, streets and areas names are changed along with a few map layout changes.

The story revolves around [[Niko Bellic]], a Serbian veteran who has moved into Liberty City to start a new life from his past war and experience the American Dream along with his cousin, Roman Bellic. Along his journey to get to the dream, he has made friends and enemies alike.

title: spider-man
body:
[b]Spider-Man[/b] is a fictional [[marvel|Marvel Comics]] superhero. The character was created by writer-editor [[Stan Lee]] and writer-artist Steve Ditko. He first appeared in [i]Amazing Fantasy[/i] #15 (Aug. 1962).

[[Peter Parker]] was orphaned at the age of six when his parents were killed in an airplane crash overseas. He went to live with his uncle and aunt; Ben and May Parker, in Forest Hills, [[New York City]]. Parker was extremely bright and became a high honors student at Midtown High School. Parker's shyness and scholastic interest often made him a social outcast. 

While attending a public exhibition demonstrating the safe handling of nuclear laboratory waste materials sponsored by the General Techtronics Corporation, Peter was bitten by a spider which had been irradiated by a particle accelerator used in the demonstration. Making his way home afterwards, Peter discovered he had somehow gained incredible strength, agility, and the ability to cling to walls; spider-like traits that he immediately associated with the spider bite. 

In the 1970s, he was given his own [[tokusatsu]] [[spider-man (toei)|series]] in Japan where he had a [[mecha]] ([[Leopardon]]).

On [[Nijiura]], he shares a flat with [[Astaroth (Shinrabanshou)]], [[WE-tan]], and [[Yamada-san]].

title: igaa
body:
Light [[Inbit]] [[alien]] aerospace [[mecha]] from the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] 80s anime series. 

The Inbit [b]Igaa[/b] is a red mecha that is faster and more maneuverable than the [[Gurab]], but is smaller, weaker and has less powerful energy weaponry. The combat Igaa has two rapid fire energy cannons while the recon version has none.

They are usually deployed in very vast numbers (swarms). The Igaa are designed for both air and space combat.

title: bangs
body: Hair that drapes forward to hang in front of the forehead. Known in British English as a [b]fringe[/b]. As it would apply to almost every post on the site, the base [code]bangs[/code] tag is no longer used. h4. Types of bangs * !post #4382765: [[arched bangs]] - For bangs curving upward * !post #4575471: [[asymmetrical bangs]] - For bangs worn half combed back, half loose * !post #7663078: [[bangs pinned back]] - For bangs that are kept in place by a [[hairclip]], a [[hairband]] or manually * !post #7686009: [[blunt bangs]] - For straight-cut unparted bangs * !post #7461000: [[braided bangs]] - For bangs that have been braided (see also [[braid]]) * !post #7997644: [[center-flap bangs]] - A combination of [[blunt bangs]] and [[double-parted bangs]] that results in a distinctive flap of hair * !post #5735551: [[choppy bangs]] - For bangs with thin gaps of air between them * !post #7381089: [[crossed bangs]] - For bangs that criss-cross each other on the forehead * !post #7640262: [[curtained hair]] - For bangs that briefly arches upward then hangs back down while the [[parted bangs|bangs part to the side]] * !post #3043948: [[diagonal bangs]] - For bangs that are cut in an odd diagonal line * !post #7540287: [[double-parted bangs]] - For bangs that are distinctly parted in two different spots * !post #7934105: [[colored bangs]] - For bangs that are colored differently from the rest of the hair * !post #7950336: [[fanged bangs]] - For bangs with thin longer sides * !post #7986694: [[hair between eyes]] - For bangs that are found between eyes (often paired with [[crossed bangs]] or [[double-parted bangs]]) * !post #4193991: [[hair over eyes]] + [[eyes visible through hair]] - For long bangs that cover both eyes partially * !post #4415241: [[hair over eyes]] + [[covered eyes]] - For bangs that cover both eyes completely * !post #8904369: [[hair over one eye]] + [[eyes visible through hair]] - For bangs that cover a single eye partially * !post #7967265: [[hair over one eye]] + [[one eye covered]] - For bangs that cover a single eye completely * !post #7989717: [[long bangs]] - For unusually long bangs that go past the eyes at least * !post #7548225: [[loosely tucked bangs]] - Uncut, very long bangs being tucked away to the side but still hangs loosely over the face * !post #200120: [[parted bangs]] - For distinctly parted bangs * !post #7661261: [[short bangs]] - For bangs short enough to at least fully show the eyebrows * !post #8632542: [[swept bangs]] - For bangs loosely combed to one side * !post #3374800: [[v-bangs]] - A variant of blunt bangs that are longer in the middle than the sides and come to a distinct point in the center, forming a "V" shape on the forehead * !post #154015: [[wispy bangs]] - For bangs with large gaps of air between them

title: dino_buckler
body:
The transformation item for the [[Kyouryuu Sentai Zyuranger|Zyurangers]]. Made famous in the West as the [i]Power Morpher[/i] in [[Mighty Morphin Power Rangers]], with the item used as a telltale sign of a Ranger reference.

After transforming, the Dino Buckler remains visible on the uniform as the belt buckle, featuring the Dino Medals (or the Power Coins).

title: dennis_nedry
body:
Dennis Theodore Nedry was the main antagonist during the first half of the original [[Jurassic Park]] film. He was a computer programmer at Jurassic Park. Due to his financial problems and low salary, he accepted a bribe from Biosyn to smuggle [[dinosaur]] embryos off the island.

In both the film and the novel, he is slain by a Dilophosaurus. He was directly responsible for the events that happened in both the novel and film. A combination of factors led to his demise: despite working in a career around dinosaurs and other prehistoric creatures, he had a limited knowledge of them, and greed, which was intertwined by desperation to pay off his debt collectors and make himself rich after that.

title: kitasan_black_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [i][[Umamusume]][/i].

A cheerful and energetic girl who innocently takes up any challenges. She looks up to Tokai Teio and idolizes her. Her general motif is based on Japanese festivals. In the anime, she was a supporting character during Season 2. She would later become the protagonist of Season 3 and a member of Team Spica.

The original horse's name wasn't named because he had a black or brown coat (he was a simple bay) but because he is named after his sire, [i]Black[/i] Tide, an older full brother to the much more successful [[Deep Impact (Umamusume)|]].

title: mother_(yoru_mac)
body:
The nameless mother character from the "first commercial":[/posts/6702154] in the Autumn 2023 [[Yoru Mac]] commercial set made for [[McDonald's]] Japan.

In parallel to the commercial she was featured in unexpectedly gaining popularity, she similarly saw unexpected attention among western art communities as the "McDonald's [[mature female|MILF]]" and has spawned fanart in the process. In Japan, meanwhile, the nickname "McMother" caught on.

title: rave_party
body:
A type of [[party]] associated with electronic music and [[DJ]]s. Typically features bright lights and the use of [[glowstick]]s. Underground raves usually take place in a [[warehouse]], while more mainstream ones may take place in a [[nightclub]]. [[Drugs]] are commonly used at these parties, especially underground ones. Primarily attended by [[raver]]s.

h4. See also

* [[DJ]]
* [[Nightclub]]
* [[Raver]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Rave":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rave

title: raver
body:
[[Rave party]]-goers. Associated with the phrase "PLUR" (Peace-Love-Unity-Respect), [[drugs]], and electronic music.

Attire worn by ravers is often colorful and made of synthetic materials, as well as highly revealing, due to the tendency for these events to be hot and uncomfortable. [[Pasties]] are a particularly common sight. Common accessories include plastic [[bead bracelet]]s ("kandi"), [[fur leg warmers]], [[fishnet gloves]] and [[pacifier]] necklaces. They also often carry [[glowstick]]s and wear glow jewelry.

h4. See also

* [[Cyber fashion]]
* [[DJ]]
* [[Tag group:Fashion style]]

title: cyber_fashion
body:
A Japanese fashion style that emerged in the 1990s in Harajuku. It shares similarities with [[Y2K fashion]] in that it is focused on 90s and 2000s retrofuturism. It is sometimes also referred to as cyberpop.

The style primarily resolves around artificial-looking materials such as glossy vinyl, faux fur, and anything shiny. Clothing and accessories are often [[see-through clothes|see-through]], [[glowing]] or holographic. Common accessories include [[visor cap]]s, [[headphones]], [[goggles]], [[mask]]s, plastic jewelry, etc. Clothing is often brightly colored, and common motifs include aliens, stars, planets, computers, etc. [[UFO skirt]]s are commonly associated with the style.

Similar to [[cybergoth]] fashion in the West, [[cyberlox|synthetic dreadlocks]] are also sometimes worn in bright colors.

h4. Examples

title: byzantine_empire
body:
The [b]Byzantine Empire[/b] (Koine Greek: [i]Βασιλεία Ῥωμαίων[/i]), also known as the [b]Eastern Roman Empire[/b], was the continuation of the [[Roman Empire]] in its eastern provinces. 

It lasted from the 5th century AD until its fall to the [[Ottoman Empire]] in 1453. It was a powerful economic, cultural, and military force in the Mediterranean, with its capital in Constantinople (modern-day [[Istanbul]], Turkey). While its citizens identified themselves Romans, it is distinct from the earlier Roman Empire due to factors like the shift of the capital, the integration of Christianity, and the use of Greek instead of Latin.

Over its history, the Byzantine Empire went through periods of expansion and decline. It reached its peak under Emperor "Justinian I":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justinian_I, reconquering previous western Mediterranean territories. It faced challenges from conflicts, including the "Byzantine-Sasanian Wars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman%E2%80%93Persian_Wars#Byzantine%E2%80%93Sasanian_wars and "Muslim conquests":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Early_Muslim_conquests, which led to the loss of key provinces. The "Macedonian dynasty":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macedonian_dynasty oversaw a revival, but it eventually declined due to "civil wars":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Byzantine_revolts_and_civil_wars and the "Fourth Crusade":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fourth_Crusade, which divided its territories.

Making a brief recovery in 1261, the Byzantine Empire remained a regional power until its fall in 1453. The "Fall of Constantinople":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fall_of_Constantinople marked the end of the empire and the start of the early modern period. Refugees from Constantinople played a role in the [[Renaissance]], and the fall of the "Empire of Trebizond":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empire_of_Trebizond followed shortly after.

Its existence has a lasting legacy, particularly in the fields of art, architecture, law, and Christianity, which continue to influence the world to this day. It should be noted that the name "Byzantine" is actually modern term used by Historians to differentiate it from the Western Roman Empire that fell as the Byzantines at the time still called themselves as "Romans".

h4. See also

* [[Roman Empire]]
* [[Hagia Sophia]] - a former Byzantine church, turned mosque

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Byzantine Empire":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Empire]
* "Wikipedia: Byzantine Greeks":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Byzantine_Greeks]

title: hagia_sophia
body:
[b]Hagia Sophia[/b] (lit. 'Holy Wisdom'; Ancient Greek: Ἁγία Σοφία (Hagía Sophía), Turkish: Ayasofya), is a [[mosque]] and major cultural and historical site in [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey (country)|Turkey]]. It was erected three times by the Eastern Roman Empire. The present Hagia Sophia is the third, built in 537 AD. It carried several titles over its long history, serving as an Orthodox [[church]] (with a brief period as a Catholic [[cathedral]] due to the Fourth Crusade), a mosque, a [[museum]], and then a mosque again. Though [[Byzantine architecture|Byzantine-made]], it has long since received [[Middle Eastern architecture|Islamic additions]], such as its famous [[minaret]]s.

h1. See also
* [[Tag Group:Locations]]
* [[Tag Group:Real World Locations]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Hagia Sophia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hagia_Sophia

title: istanbul
body:
The largest city in the [[Turkey (country)|Republic of Turkiye]]. Originally known as "Constantinople" before being renamed to its current name in 1930. Served as the capital of the [[Ottoman Empire]] and the [[Byzantine Empire]], with the city being founded as the capital of the Eastern [[Roman Empire]] in 330 AD by [[Constantine the Great]].

Originally sitting only on the Western side of the Straits of Bosporus, the city has long-since spread to be on both sides. Notable landmarks include the [[Hagia Sophia]].

title: alice_(alice_in_wonderland)
body:
The main character of [[Alice in Wonderland]]. A curious little girl who ends up on an unplanned adventure when she falls down a rabbit hole. Throughout the story she is in search of the [[White Rabbit (alice In Wonderland)|]].

Alice is popularly depicted wearing a pale blue knee-length dress with a white [[apron|pinafore]] overtop. Her hair is held back with a wide ribbon.

Since many early illustrations were black and white, her colors would vary from artist to artist; it was [[Disney]] who made blue the most popular color for her dress [[blue eyes|her eyes]] and [[blonde_hair|blonde]] for her hair. Completing the signature appearance are white [[pantyhose]], [[bloomers]] and a black [[hairband]].

Disney's depiction of Alice is so popular that in subsequent media, it is common for a character named "Alice" to share the aforementioned traits from Disney's Alice (especially her costumes as well as her hair and eye color), even if that said character has nothing to do with Alice in Wonderland itself.

h4. See also

* [[American Mcgee's Alice]]
* [[Alice (alice in wonderland) (cosplay)|Alice (Cosplay)]]

title: diabellstar_the_black_witch
body:
A [[Duel Monster]] and the main character of the Sinful Spoil card storyline from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. Diabellstar is a treasure hunter who seeks to collect the "Sinful Spoils", sentient magical artifacts with immense power.

She normally has [[pale skin]], [[grey hair]] with [[streaked hair|streaked]] [[red hair|red]] and [[green hair]] on her sides, and [[yellow eyes|yellow-ish]] [[grey eyes]], though her right eye will turn [[green eyes|green]] once she dons her red [[half mask]] and using the power of the "Sinful Spoil". Her body is also noticeably more [[toned female|muscular]] than the other Duel Monster female protagonist, though this detail is often omitted in some fanarts.

Initially introduced as a calm and stoic character, but later cards reveals that she is quite expressive, somewhat hot-headed, and a bit of a drunkard.

h4. See also

* [[Astellar of the White Forest]] (Younger version)
* [[Like the Diabell]] (Teenage version)

body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. [[Diabellstar the Black Witch]]'s rival and childhood friend in the Sinful Spoils storyline. In stark contrast to Diabellstar's Dark Spellcaster-Type, Diabellze is a Light Illusion-type Monster.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[purple hair|purple]] hair tips, she wears an all-white [[witch hat]] and tight bodysuit-like outfit with [[asymmetrical_sleeves|no sleeves on her right arm]] to make room for her sinful spoil attached there. She also has a faint [[heterochromia]] with her left eye being [[purple eyes|purple]] while her right were purplish-[[blue eyes|blue]], though this is often [[alternate eye color|omitted in fanarts]] by making both eyes either purple or blue instead.

h4. Variants

title: lovely_labrynth_of_the_silver_castle
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 8
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Fiend / Effect
[i]
Your opponent cannot activate monster effects in response to the activation of your Normal Trap Cards. You can only use each of the following effects of "Lovely Labrynth of the Silver Castle" once per turn. You can target 1 Normal Trap in your GY; Set it to your field, but it cannot be activated unless you control a Fiend monster. If another monster(s) leaves the field by your Normal Trap effect (except during the Damage Step): You can destroy 1 card in your opponent's hand (at random) or their field.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2900
[b]DEF:[/b] 1900


A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]], a [[demon girl|demoness]] boss monster of the Labrynth archetype. It is hinted that she has some kind of affection for the [[knight (yu-gi-oh!)|nameless knight]] shown in her various artworks.

She is a [[white hair]]-ed [[demon girl]] with large [[demon horns]] and [[grey eyes]]. She has [[twin drills|drill]] [[twintails]], and wears a [[white dress]] with [[armored corset]] and [[leotard]]-like undergarments, exposing her [[cleavage]], [[large breasts]] (often further [[huge breasts|upsized to huge]]), and in her official art, her [[armpits]]. She has [[multiple_wings|two pairs of]] [[demon wings]], one at her back and one [[low wings|at her hips]]. Her weapon of choice is a large labrys.

When she's not battling, she wears a grey [[track suit]].

h4. Variants
* [[Lady Labrynth of the Silver Castle]] - her "boss battle" mode

title: precure_all_stars
body:
An annual [[in-franchise crossover]] movie series which brings in the [[Precure]] characters together, starting from the [[Futari wa Precure]] characters and ending with the [[Mahou Girls Precure!]] characters. Afterwards, new crossover movies only include the three most recent generations to limit the amount of characters, with All Stars returning for the [[anniversary|anniversaries]], replacing that season's standalone movie.

This tag can also be used on generic crossover pictures that include Cures from [[everyone|most or every series]], or include [[Sakagami Ayumi]]/[[Cure Echo]], [[Preme_(precure)|Preme]]/[[Cure Supreme]], [[Puca_(precure)|Puca]]/[[Cure Puca]].

title: lacrima_the_crimson_tears
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. Lacrima is the companion of [[Fiendsmith Engraver]] and one of the demon bounded under his magical contract. She was spared by Engraver after pleading for mercy, and later became his closest ally despite the former's initial hatred against demons.

She appeared as a [[blonde hair|blonde-haired]] [[demon girl]] with [[red eyes]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[red dress]] with [[cleavage cutout]]. True to her epithet, she is almost always seen with a pink tear-like liquid flowing from her eyes, which is tagged as [[runny makeup]] on Danbooru.

In fanarts, Lacrima is frequently depicted as a loyal [[gyaru]] girlfriend of Engraver, who is usually nonchalant from the latter's display of affection.
other_names: 紅涙の魔ラクリモーサ

title: space_pirate_(metroid)
body:
Hostile group featured in the [[Metroid]] series. They are militarized [[alien]]s that raid space vessels, conquer planets and utilize bioweapons. They are responsible for many galactic crises, like the weaponization of [[Metroid (creature)|]]s. 

They take various appearances throughout the games, but the most common one are the [[Zebesian]]s from Planet Zebes.

title: underworld_goddess_of_the_closed_world
body:
A Link-5 [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]], primarily used to remove opponent's monster by using them as one of her summoning materials. As her OCG name (Saros-Eres Kunugias) implies, she is based on the Sumerian goddess Ereshkigal.

She has [[black hair|black]] [[medium hair]] with [[pale skin]] and [[red eyes]], wearing a black [[gothic lolita]] [[dress]]. She is often accompanied by an black [[dragon]] named "Kur" in the background.

h4. Variants
* [[Moon of the Closed Heaven]].
other_names: 閉ザサレシ世界ノ冥神

title: moon_of_the_closed_heaven
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]]. The [[aged down|younger]] form [[Underworld Goddess of the Closed World]].

She is frequently grouped with [[Fiendsmith Engraver]] and/or [[Lacrima the Crimson Tears]] due to her ease of summoning and her typing (Light Fiend) allowed player to user her as a "starter" for the Fiendsmith theme combo.

title: silent_magician
body:
A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] notable for being the monster that [[Muto Yugi|Muto Yugi]] used to win his duel against [[Atem]] during their ceremonial duel.

This tag can be applied to any form (or "Level") of Silent Magician, primarily her adult Level 8 version or the retrained Level 4 version. For her younger form, uses [[Silent Magician Lv4]] instead.

h4. See also
* [[Silent Magician Zero]]

title: ki-sikil_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The more energetic member of the Live Twins online celebrity duo in the [[duel_monster|Yu-Gi-Oh Official Card Game]]. With the help of [[Lil-la (yu-gi-oh!)|Lil-la]], Ki-sikil steals priceless riches using the data they phished from their online livestreams.

In the [i]Card Game Art Works[/i], it is revealed that that she's having [[yuri|a romantic relationship]] with Lil-la, and she is acquainted with both [[I:P Masquerena]] and [[S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru]].

In both of her forms [[long hair|long]] [[pink hair]], [[green eyes]] and a [[tail]].
In her [[Live Twin Ki-sikil|Live Twin]] form she has [[twintails]], [[shorts]], and is wearing a [[cropped vest]].
In her [[Evil Twin Ki-sikil|Evil Twin]] form she has [[glasses]], [[gloves]], [[thigh strap|thigh straps]], [[wings]] and [[large breasts]]

title: lil-la_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The shy, more reserved member of the Live☆Twin online celebrity duo in the [[duel_monster|Yu-Gi-Oh Official Card Game]]. With the help of [[Ki-sikil (yu-gi-oh!)|Ki-sikil]], Lil-la steals priceless riches using the data they phished from their online livestreams. She has a bit of a money fetish.

In the [i]Card Game Art Works[/i], it is revealed that that she's having [[yuri|a romantic relationship]] with Ki-skil, and she is acquainted with both [[I:P Masquerena]] and [[S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru]].

In both of her forms [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]] and [[wings]].
In her [[Live Twin Lil-la|Live Twin]] form she has a streak of [[blonde hair]], has a [[stuffed shark]], and is wearing a [[dress]].
In her [[Evil Twin Lil-la|Evil Twin]] form she has [[glasses]], [[gloves]], [[checkered legwear]], a [[tail]] and [[large breasts]]

title: little_witch_academia:_chamber_of_time
body: Little Witch Academia: Chamber of Time[a] is an action role-playing video game developed by A+ Games and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment, based on the anime franchise [[Little Witch Academia]].

title: amanda_o'neill
body: Character from [[Little Witch Academia]], Amanda O'Neill (アマンダ・オニール, Amanda Onīru?) is one of supporting protagonists of Little Witch Academia who made her debut in the film The Enchanted Parade. She is one of three troublemaking girls alongside Constanze and Jasminka where in her case, guilty in repeatedly sneaking into Luna Nova's storehouses and toying with its security systems for fun. Amanda is also the 16 years old heiress of a magical family of dubious reputation from United States skilled in Flight Magic, having penchant of stealing, and rather quick to start a fight.

title: sky_striker_ace_-_raye
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 4
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Warrior / Effect
[i](Quick Effect): You can Tribute this card; Special Summon 1 "Sky Striker Ace" monster from your Extra Deck to the Extra Monster Zone. While this card is in your GY, if a face-up "Sky Striker Ace" Link Monster you control is destroyed by battle, or leaves the field because of an opponent's card effect: You can Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Sky Striker Ace - Raye" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 1500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1500

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], and the only Main Deck monster of the Sky Striker series, until the release of [[Sky Striker Ace - Roze]], her rival in the card lore.

Due to her popularity thanks to the lore of her archtype as well as her usage in both casual and competitive scene, she became the first protagonist of [i][[Yu-Gi-Oh! OCG Stories]][/i], a serialized manga about the lore of various Yu-Gi-Oh! duel monsters.

title: hu-li_the_jewel_mikanko
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Wind
[b]Type:[/b] Psychic / Effect
[i]
If this card is not equipped with an Equip Card, you take no damage from battles involving this card. If this card is equipped with an Equip Card, it cannot be destroyed by battle and your opponent takes any battle damage you would have taken from battles involving this card. While you control an Equip Card, your opponent cannot target "Mikanko" cards you control with card effects. If either player equips an Equip Card(s) to this card: You can add 1 "Mikanko" Trap from your Deck to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Hu-Li the Jewel Mikanko" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 0
[b]DEF:[/b] 0

A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]], part of the "Mikanko" archetype. Hu-Li the Jewel Mikanko wears a green [[japanese clothes]] and manifesting a [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]] when empowered. She can controls two [[orb]]s with her wind power and [[folding fan]], which are based on the the Yasakani-no-Magatama. She is the daughter of the Mitama house.

Based on the Card Game Art Works, Hu-Li may appear as ambitious and confident, who seems to be able to accomplish multiple things with ease. But actually, she is a very awkward girl who is terrible at expressing her inner feeling.

title: s-force_rappa_chiyomaru
body:
A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Duel Monster]]. Chiyomaru is a [[ninja]] who was once the member of the S-Force, she protects the city from ne'er-do-wells and other criminals. As a result, she tends to clash with [[I:P Masquerena]] from time to time, making them rivals in the S-Force Storyline.

She becomes [[S:P Little Knight]] after defecting from the S-Force Organization due to an as-of-yet undisclosed motive.

title: i:p_masquerena
body:
[b]Link Rating[/b]: 2
[b]Link Arrows[/b]: Bottom left, bottom right
[b]Attribute[/b]: Dark
[b]Type[/b]: Cyberse / Link / Effect
[i]2 non-Link Monsters
During your opponent's Main Phase, you can (Quick Effect): Immediately after this effect resolves, Link Summon 1 Link Monster using materials you control, including this card. You can only use this effect of "I:P Masquerena" once per turn. A Link Monster that used this card as material cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects.[/i]

[b]ATK[/b]: 800

A [[duel monster]] from [[yu-gi-oh!_ocg_structures|Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. I:P Masquerena is a courier that steals and delivers illegal data.

She is the rival of [[S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru]] in the S-Force storyline. Because of this rivalry, along with Chiyomaru's later defection from the S-Force as [[S:P Little Knight]] as well as their in-game synergy, she's often paired with Chiyomaru in love-hate themed [[yuri]] fanart.

h4. See also
* [[EM:P Meowmine]]

title: ch'en_(arknights)
body:
[i]Ch'en, Special Inspection Unit Chief, L.G.D., is cooperating with Rhodes Island to fulfill the obligations outlined in her contract[/i]

A playable Guard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Ch'en Hui-Chieh

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]

The head of the Lungmen Guard Department's Special Inspection Unit. During her time with the Department, she cracked down on crime, fought violent offenders, tracked down armed fugitives, and brought down international criminals. She also works at Rhodes Island, providing on-site tactical command.

She is the primary protagonist in the story [i]Episode 5: Necessary Solution[/i].

Her motif is based on a Chinese dragon.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Ishigami Shizuka|Shizuka Ishigami]] (Japanese), Jen Zhang (Mandarin), Bao Shaoye (Cantonese), Amy Lennox (English), and Chung Yu-joung (Korean). Her original art designer is [[yui (niikyouzou)|yui]], while her [b]After the Storm[/b] outfit is drawn by [[five-fall]].
