title: kal'tsit_(arknights)
body:
[i]Rhodes Island Medical Department Officer-in-Charge, Kal'tsit.[/i]

A playable Medic Operator character in [[Arknights]].

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Rhodes Island[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]

      [td]169 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]3 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Kal'tsit was a playable character during the beta testing of Arknights, but was cut due to being overpowered prior to the final release of the game, remaining an NPC. She was made playable again in the event [i]Under Tides[/i].

She is able to summon the familiar [[Mon3tr (arknights)|]] during combat. Her motif is based on lynxes. Her callsign is the Russian word for "[i]calcite[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calcite.

She was designed by [[Lowlight Kirilenko]], who previously designed [[Kal'tsit (Pixiv Fantasia)|her]] and [[Mon5tr (Pixiv Fantasia)|her familiar]] for [[Pixiv Fantasia T]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Hikasa Youko]] (JP), Liu Xue (CN), Sura Siu (EN), and Han Chae-eon (KR)

title: mr_magical_girl
body:
A Korean dark magical girl manhwa.

Story: 202X.

In the back alleys of Seoul, South Korea… He looked down at the heroes under his feet—the heroes who adorned themselves in a variety of colorful clothes, as if they were K-pop idols on TV. Those heroes? They were crawling beneath him, their gaudy outfits smeared with dirt. That was the true nature of being a hero. He hoped the individuals before him learned that lesson well. It was time to ensure they never forgot it. As a magical girl, he swung his hammer down. This is a bright story. The story of a man reclaiming his light.

title: ambience_synesthesia
body:
[b]Ambience Synesthesia[/b] is an annual real-world live concert featuring music from [[Arknights]], hosted by Hypergryph in China. The first concert was held in May 2021, the second took place in October 2022,  the third between April-May 2023 and the fourth in May 2024.

As part of the concert's promotion, some of the Arknights characters were drawn with new costumes.

The Ambience Synesthesia tag is to be used when an Arknights character is wearing costumes from the concert.

title: mother_brain
body:
The main antagonist and final boss of [[Metroid (classic)|]], it's [[metroid:_zero_mission|remake]] and [[Super Metroid]]. The once benevolent [[Chozo]] supercomputer that ascended into being the leader of the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s due to her ability to propagate and weaponize [[Metroid (creature)|]]s. 

She is an artificial [[brain]] with [[spikes]] jutting out and has a [[one-eyed|single eyeball]]. She is protected in a massive [[tank_(container)|glass container]] that is connected with [[wire]]s and [[cable]]s. In Super Metroid she even gains a fully mechanical body that has a mouth, torso, arms and legs. 

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25472148: Default
* !asset #25472146: [[Metroid (classic)]]
* !asset #25472147: [[Super Metroid]] (Second Form)

title: phantoon
body:
A boss in [[Super Metroid]] and [[Metroid: Other M]]. It is a [[monster|monstrous]] ghost-like extraterrestrial that can phase in and out of existence interdimensionally. It lurked within an ancient [[Chozo]] spaceship that crash landed on Planet Zebes, implying that spaceship to be the current Wrecked Ship where it resides and the cause of its crash.

It's body is similar to that of a cephalopod that has a [[one-eyed|single eyeball]] inside it's mouth full of [[sharp teeth]] and two [[tentacles]] outstretched on each side. It's attacks foes with [[blue_fire|blue]] [[fireball]]s that resemble [[hitodama]]s and can summon a legion of creepy [[disembodied hand]]s that are also [[one-eyed|single eyed]]. According to Phantoon's concept art in Metroid: Other M, the creature seen in the material world is only it's head, and the rest of it's body is in another dimension [tn]"[1]":[https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/metroid/images/4/41/Phantoonghost.jpg/][/tn].

It's lore in Super Metroid is contradictory between the Japanese and English manuals. In English it's a being that only taps into [[Mother Brain]]'s brainwaves to feed off it, while in Japanese it is Mother Brain's consciousness itself manifested.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25472049: Super Metroid
* !asset #25472050: Metroid: Other M

title: battle_of_the_coral_sea
body:
One of the first [[naval battle]]s of the Pacific theatre of operations in [[World War II]] fought between the [[United States Navy]] and the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] in May 1942, it was the first naval battle between [[aircraft carrier]]s and their air groups. It was fought without the [[ship]]s engaging each other directly. 

It ended in an apparent Japanese tactical victory due to the sinking of the American aircraft carrier the [[USS Lexington (CV-2)]] , but also in a decisive, but costly, American strategic victory due to the delay of the Japanese island hopping campaign and experience that helped their later success during the [[Battle of Midway]].

title: demon_pillar_(fate)
body:
The boss enemies in [[Fate/Grand Order]], related to the seventy-two Demon Gods of Solomon. Appeared as a tower of flesh with eyes all over it.

Known in Japanese as 魔神柱 (まじんちゅう, Majin-chuu), where 柱 ([i]chuu[/i], "pillar") is a "Japanese counter word":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_counter_word] for gods, deities and [[spirit tablet]]s.

Best known for an incident described in post #2576688, in which a much-hyped game event quickly ended after the Demon Pillars were quickly defeated due to over-farming by players.

h4. See also

title: hapu_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Hapu[/b], known as [b]Hapu'u[/b] (ハプウ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sm|Sun and Moon]][/i].

An Island Kahuna who wanders the islands of Alola and has been accepted by its guardian deities, she inherited her title and speaking style from her greatly respected grandfather.

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] worn in [[twintails]]. She wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] [[bonnet]], a [[black belt]] carrying a [[pouch]], [[grey gloves]], and [[black boots]].

body:
[i]The crimson Nightzmora Narantuya walks her own Khaganquest.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Narantuya Kapudan

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]

      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]

A former desert bandit and treasure hunter of Sargon, 
one of the few remaining Nightzmora descents, and the distant descendant of [[ Kharanduu Khagan (arknights)|]].
Now stationed long-term as a field Operator on Rhodes Island, 
as part of her race's coming-of-age conquering ceremony, the "Khaganquest".

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Yukino Satsuki]] (JP), Shao Minjia (CN), Elisabeth Snegir (EN), and Kim Soon-mi (KR). Her illustrator is [[eboda-x]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #8170527: Default

title: full_armor_unicorn_gundam
body:
The heavily armed upgrade of the [[unicorn_gundam|RX-0 Unicorn Gundam]]. It is piloted by [[Banagher Links]].

The Full Armor Mode was an enhancement plan devised by [[Irei Takuya]] while aboard the Nahel Argama and is based on Takuya's extensive knowledge of mobile suits. After Banagher's Newtype potential manifests itself, the [[Psycho Frame]] changes color to a vibrant green. Unlike other mobile suits with the Full Armor designation, the FA Unicorn does not consist of any additional armor for the MS frame itself (except extra [[shield|shields]]). However it does introduce a large array of weapons, which are added to the legs, backpack and forearms.

At first glance, what appears to be a haphazard collection of weaponry is actually a superbly balanced set-up which draws out the maximum combat potential of the Unicorn. The new array of weapons includes two backpack-mounted hyper bazookas, numerous hand grenades and grenade launchers, missile pods, forearm-mounted Gatling guns, and two additional I-field-equipped shields, one on the backpack and the other on the right forearm. The backpack also features two massive vernier-boosters taken from a [[base_jabber|Base Jabber Type 94]] to compensate for the increased mass, with one of the additional shields situated between them. The unit's entire weapons load can be disconnected at any time if the ammunitions are completely spent to avoid becoming dead-weight. Like the normal Unicorn, the Full Armor Unicorn can take control of an enemy's psycommu weapons, even Quasi-Psycommu bits, when the [[NT-D]] is activated.

Just like the original Unicorn, its Full Armor version is designed in real life by [[Katoki Hajime]].

title: tadano_kazuhito
body: Baseball player for the the Cleveland Indians and [[Manatsu No Yo No Inmu]] actor in college. During the scandal, his name was abbreviated to TDN, which became the common abbreviating standard for Inmu and later [[Cookie (touhou)|]].

title: magma_(medium)
body: [url=https://magma.com]Magma.com[/url] is a browser-based art creation and project management platform that uses generative AI to create finished pieces with other artists. The platform was founded in 2016 by artist and engineer Radek Eichler, who created the platform after realizing that no other tools allowed him to collaborate with his friends from around the world. Magma.com offers a free version of its platform, Magma Studio, and a premium version, Magma Pro, which includes additional features and a subscription service.

title: combo_counter
body:
A piece of text in [[gameplay mechanics|video games]], most commonly in rhythm and fighting games, showing the player's current combo streak. In rhythm games, this is usually the number of notes hit in a row without missing, while in fighting games, it typically denotes the number of attacks landed in a chain.

h4. See also

* [[accuracy judgement]]

title: accuracy_judgement
body:
A [[gameplay mechanics|mechanic]] of rhythm games, a piece of short flavor text that reflects how accurately timed the player hit a note.

They vary depending on the game - [[Dance Dance Revolution]] for example uses Marvelous - Perfect - Great - Miss.

h4. See also

title: mori_calliope_(kawaiiope)
body:
The 10th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mori Calliope]].

It consists of a buttoned [[white shirt]] with [[shoulder cutout]]s and [[puffy sleeves]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] or [[blue skirt|blue]] [[high-waist skirt]], a [[thigh strap]] on her left leg and [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. She can also swap the shirt for a [[blue sweater]] from Underworld University, and has [[white-framed eyewear|white]] [[glasses]] and a [[Death-sensei (mori calliope)|]] [[stuffed toy|plushie]] as accessories.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]]s in this costume:

* Her [[mori calliope (1st costume)|default hairstyle]]
* [[Long hair|Long]] [[wavy hair]] with [[swept bangs]], [[hair flower|flowers]] and [[one side up]]
* And a [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]]

It is a rock themed outfit consisting of an [[off shoulder]] [[fur-trimmed jacket]] over a [[black corset]], [[black shorts]], [[torn legwear|torn]] [[leggings]] and [[black boots]]. She also has [[headphones around neck|headphones around her neck]] along with a [[studded choker|studded]] [[black choker]], and can wear either a [[rabbit ear hairband]] or [[Tutu (mori calliope)|]] on her head as an accessory.

She has 3 different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] for this costume:

title: mori_calliope_(sheriff)
body:
The 7th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mori Calliope]].

It's a sheriff's costume consisting of a [[black hat|black]] [[cowboy hat]] a [[black choker]] a [[partially unbuttoned]] [[white shirt]] wir [[long sleeves]] [[sleeves rolled up|rolled up]], a black [[bolo tie]], a black [[cross-laced top|cross-laced]] [[bodice]] going [[underbust]], a pair of [[chaps]] worn over [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], a pair of [[holster]]s with [[holstered]] revolvers, [[thigh strap]]s on both her legs and [[black boots|black]] [[cowboy boots]]. She also has an optional [[two-sided coat|two-sided]] [[black coat|black]] and [[red coat]].

body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Mori Calliope]], released on 06/07 February 2023.

It's [[sleepwear]]-themed attire, consisting of a [[black choker|black]] [[pendant choker]] with a skull pendant, a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] [[black nightgown]] with [[empire waist]], a pair of [[bracelet]]s on her left wrist [[grey slippers]] themed after [[Death-sensei (mori calliope)|]].

She has 2 [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] in this costume:
* [[long hair|Long]] [[messy hair]] decorated with a [[sleep mask]]

She also wears [[hoop earrings]] and multiple [[necklace]]s.

As of March 9th, 2023, Calli has three different [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyles]] for this costume:
* A [[long hair|chest-length]] [[ponytail]]
* A [[short hair|short]] [[bob cut]] [[self-borrowed hairstyle|borrowed]] from [[mori calliope (new year)|her New Year's kimono]]

title: zhuge_liang
body:
A famous tactician from the Romance of the Three Kingdoms. Also known as "Kongming". Originally a man, but now has countless female portrayals.

Besides his portrayal in the book (Where he appears to be almost omniscient), there are a few memes and phrases involving his portrayal by Yokoyama Mitsuteru (Several variants of "Kongming's Trap" or "Now!") and his portrayal in Koei's games.

h4. See also

* [[Zhuge Liang (Shin Sangoku Musou)|]] ([[Shin Sangoku Musou]])

h4. External Links

* "Wikipedia: Zhuge Liang":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhuge_Liang]

title: youmu_day
body: Youmu day is a holiday dedicated to [[Konpaku Youmu]] from [[Touhou]].  It is celebrated on the two dates that form Youmu's name in "goroawase":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_wordplay#Goroawase]: [b]April 6th[/b] (よ,む / yo,mu) and [b]August 6th[/b] (よう,む / you,mu).

title: ishowspeed
body: Darren Jason Watkins Jr. (born January 21, 2005), known online as IShowSpeed or simply Speed, is an American [[youtube|YouTuber]], media personality and online streamer. He is known for the dramatic and energetic behavior showcased in his variety live streams, as well as his in-real-life (IRL) streams in worldwide locations.

title: torpedo_bomber
body:
A type of [[bomber]] designed to carry [[torpedo]]es for attacking enemy [[warship]]s.

Though first used in [[World War I]], torpedo planes were most prevalent during [[World War II]], before their role was gradually replaced by multi-role aircraft and [[missile]]s.

title: dive_bomber
body:
A type of [[bomber]] designed for precision attacks. The "dive" in the name comes from the fact that most of these bombers are designed to enter a steep, near vertical dive when attacking their target to guarantee accuracy. 

This type of aircraft was only used during [[World War II]], as even during the conflict the dive bomber was already being replaced by multi-role aircraft.

title: kurashiki_akane
body:
A central character in [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]], appearing in all three games. Childhood friend and love interest of [[Junpei (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]], and [spoiler]the true identity of [[Zero (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. [[Santa (kyokugen_dasshutsu)|]] is her older brother.[/spoiler]

Has [[purple eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into a [[side ponytail]].

In [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|999]], she wears a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black shirt]] under a [[purple dress]], along with [[brown boots]] and [[multicolored socks]]. In this game only, she is referred to by the codename "Murasaki" ("June" in English).

A [[aged down|younger version]] of her is seen in flashbacks throughout the game. Unlike her present-day self, she has her [[hair down]]. She wears a [[pink shirt]] with a [[floral print|flower]] design over a [[collared shirt|collared]], [[white shirt]] and [[red necktie|red tie]], a [[black hairband]], a [[blue skirt]], and [[knee boots|knee-high]] [[black boots]].

In [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu Adv: Zennin Shibou Desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]], [spoiler]she appears as an [[old woman]] with [[grey hair]], wearing a [[blue dress|blue]] [[turtleneck dress]] with [[asymmetrical sleeves]], [[white shoes]], and a [[ring]] on her right hand. Her younger self appears at the very end of the game, donning the same [[gas mask]] she wore as Zero, as well as a [[black robe]].[/spoiler]

In [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]], she is a member of "C-Team" alongside Junpei and [[Carlos (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. She wears a [[cable knit]] [[dress]] over a [[purple shirt]]. Around her waist is a thick [[black sash|black cloth belt]] with a [[bow]] and gold [[buckle]] on the front. She has dark [[brown pantyhose]] on and wears dark [[red shoes|red]] [[oxfords|oxford]] [[flats]] with black laces.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25437568: [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|999]]
* !asset #25437570: 999 (Young)
* !asset #25437569: [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]]

h4. External links
* "Zero Escape Wiki":https://zeroescape.fandom.com/wiki/Akane_Kurashiki

title: futaba_sana_(swimsuit_costume)
body:
An unplayable [[official alternate costume|costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]].

It is a [[green bikini|green]] [[plaid bikini]] with a [[frilled bikini|frilled]] [[halterneck]], a [[yellow ribbon]] on [[front-tie bikini top|front]] of the top and [[side-tie bikini bottom|sides]] of the bottom, and a [[bikini skirt]]. She also wears a [[single wrist cuff|wrist cuff]] and a [[ring]].

Her [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[aqua hair]] is tied into [[hair rings|rings]] with a pair of [[yellow scrunchie]]s and she has [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]] and [[blunt bangs]].

title: futaba_sana_(roomwear_costume)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] for [[Futaba Sana]] in [[Magia Record: Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Gaiden]]. Originally designed for a pop-up store in Tokyo Anime Center and released on merchandise in February 2022, though it was adapted into a in-game costume one year later.

Sana's [[medium hair|medium]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[aqua hair]] is tied into [[twintails]] with [[hair beads|beads]] and decorated with a [[Kyubey]]-[[objectification|themed]] [[sleep mask]]. She also has [[blunt bangs|blunt]] [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]] and [[green eyes]]. 

She wears a [[short dress|short]] [[green dress]] with [[vertical-striped dress|vertical stripes]], [[buttons]], [[short sleeves]] and a [[wing collar|wing]] [[collared dress|collar]], a [[ring]], a [[white jacket|white]] [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[jacket]] with [[pocket]]s, [[yellow_leg_warmers|yellow]] [[leg warmers]] with a [[floral print|floral]] [[print leg warmers|print]] and [[green slippers]].

title: fingernails
body:
Tag used when fingernails are noticeable in the image, i.e. the fingers aren't simply stubs.

For fingernails protruding past the fingertip up to approximately one centimeter, state [[long fingernails]]. Beyond that, use [[very long fingernails]]. If they have [[nail polish]] on them, feel free to add that as well. If they're highly decorated, use [[nail art]].


h4.See also

* [[toenails]]

title: panchiko
body:
Indie rock band from Nottingham, England formed between 1997 and 1998 which gained notoriety after their 2001 demo EP "D>E>A>T>H>M>E>T>A>L" was discovered by [[4chan]]'s /mu/ board. The band's current lineup consists of: Owain Davies, Andy Wright, Shaun Ferreday, John Schofield and Rob Harris.

The cover of [b]D>E>A>T>H>M>E>T>A>L[/b] features [[Makimura Miyu]] from the manga [[Mint na Bokura]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Panchiko":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panchiko]
* "Official Website":[https://panchiko.net/]

body: A distinct type of robe worn by certain characters in [[Final Fantasy XIV]]. Often accompanied by a [[mask around neck]].

title: gameplay_ability
body:
A character from a video game using an ability or action found in said game, typically shown by drawing the icon of said action or a cast bar with its name.

Commonly depicted in fanart of MMORPGs, which have named abilities with unique and recognizable icons.

A subset of [[gameplay mechanics]].

title: python_(girls'_frontline)
body:
An android representing the American-made [[Colt Python]] [[revolver]] in the game [[Girls' Frontline]].

Python is a very stylish lady with [[tsurime|sharp]] [[green eyes]], [[long hair|long]], [[messy hair|messy]] [[hair between eyes|hair]] that [[gradient hair|fades]] from [[black hair|black]] to [[blue hair|blue]], a [[mole under eye|mole underneath her left eye]], and [[mole on breast|another on her right breast]]. She also uses [[yellow lips]] and [[yellow nails|yellow]] [[painted nails|nail polish]]. 

She wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[crop top]] and [[white necktie]] under a [[double-breasted]] [[white jacket|white]] [[suit jacket]] that's [[navel|open at the bottom]], [[two-tone gloves|black-and-green]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]] with [[hip vent]]s, and [[black footwear|black]] [[armored boots|armored]] [[high heel boots|high-heeled]] [[boots]]. 

Python's equipment and accessories consist of her namesake revolver, a [[holster]] slung on a [[high belt|high-riding]] [[belt]], a [[star pin]] [[lapel pin|on her jacket lapel]], [[arm belt|arm belts]] on [[sleeves pushed up|pushed-up sleeves]], small [[hoop earrings]], two types of [[stud earrings]], a silver [[hair ornament]], and occasionally a green [[lollipop|sucker]].

h4. Appearance

title: mika_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. She's a Trinity student and a former member of the [[Tea Party (blue archive)|]]. Her full name is Misono Mika. 

She has a [[pink halo]], [[yellow eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]] [[pink hair]], with a [[single side bun|single]] [[side up bun]] and a [[hair flower]], in addition to [[low wings|low]] [[angel wings]] that have [[wing ornament|wing ornaments]].

Her regular outfit consists of a [[white capelet]] over a [[medium dress|medium]], [[double-breasted|double breast buttoned]], [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]], [[white dress|white]], [[frilled dress]]; a [[white skirt|white]], [[high-waist skirt]]; a [[underbust]] [[overskirt]]; a [[wrist scrunchie]]; [[white pantyhose]]; and [[black shoes|black]] [[pumps]].

Her personal weapon is based on the [[Lanchester SMG]].

Voiced by: [[Touyama Nao]]
Original artist: [[yutokamizu]]

title: zodiac_axis
body:
A mystery visual novel (story-based with choices) that blends suspense, romance, and Asian-inspired fantasy elements.

The main character, [[alison_harte|Alison Harte]], is a tabloid journalist who is assigned to investigate six unusual people who are rumored to carry the "Spirits of the Zodiacs", wielding mysterious powers connecting them to the ancient founders of Lunar City.

It was created by "LunaChaiLi" (Going under the name of "Studio Theophilus"), with a demo launching in 2017. Active development on the game was halted in January 2020 due to a combination of technical issues and creative burnout from the dev team. As of 2021, the game has halted development "in the background," with no official release date.

h4. External Links
* "VNdb game link":https://vndb.org/v20388
* "Steam game link":https://store.steampowered.com/app/946370/Zodiac_Axis/
* "ItchIo game link":https://lunachaili.itch.io/zodiacaxis
* "Blog post: Halted Development":https://studiotheophilus.com/blog/no-longer-under-active-development

title: dark_souls_i
body:
[b]Dark Souls[/b] is the first game of the [[dark souls (series)|Dark Souls trilogy]]. Dark Souls is the spiritual successor to [[Demon's Souls]] and the second installment in the [[dark souls (series)|series]]. 

The game was released in 2011 for [[Playstation 3]] and [[Xbox 360]]. In 2012, [i]Dark Souls: Prepare To Die Edition[/i] was released for PC, which was later ported to consoles.

title: helmina_lent
body:
[[World Witches Series]] character who debuted in Contrail of Witches. Full name: Helmina Johanna Siglinde Lent.

A [[hirschgeweih_antennas|night witch]] and Wing Commander of the Karlsland Air Force 3rd Night Fighter Wing. She has dark [[brown hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. The first night witch to have reached a kill count of 100

Her weapons are a MG 151/20 machine gun and a 20mm MG FF cannon. She is based on "Helmut Lent":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Helmut_Lent and her familiar is a German Shepard.

title: nagisa_(blue_archive)
body:
A character from [[Blue Archive]]. Member of the [[tea_party_(blue_archive)|Tea Party]]. Her full name is Kirifuji Nagisa.

She has [[long hair|long]] light [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and [[white wings|white]] [[feathered wings|feathered]] [[angel wings]]. Her usual hairstyle is a [[crown braid]] with [[double-parted bangs]] and decorate with a pair of [[hair flower]]s.

Her default outfit consists of a [[white shrug]] worn over a [[white dress|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[sailor dress]] with [[long sleeves]] (which gives her [[short over long sleeves]]), a [[white sailor collar]] with a [[black neckerchief]], a [[black pantyhose]] and [[white shoes|white]] [[pumps]]. She also has a [[chest harness]] with a [[holster]] hanging from it.

Her personal weapon is a [[Walther]] PP [[handgun]].

Voiced by: [[Hayami Saori]]
Original artist: [[famepeera]] (original design)/[[DoReMi (doremi4704)]] (in-game art)

h4. Appearance

* !post #6082509: Profile

h4. External links

title: cardcaptor_sakura
body:
A popular manga and anime created by [[CLAMP (circle)|]]. Known as Cardcaptors in America.

The story centers on  Kinomoto Sakura, an elementary school student who discovers magical powers after accidentally freeing a set of magical cards into the world; she must retrieve the cards to prevent catastrophe. Each of these cards grants different magical powers, and can only be activated by someone with inherent magical abilities. A sequel, [[Cardcaptor Sakura Clear Card Arc]], was released from 2016 until 2024.

For the complete list of characters, costumes and items, see the [[list of Cardcaptor Sakura characters]].

title: himeya_company_uniform
body:
The uniform worn by [[undine (aria)|Undines]] under the Himeya Company in [i][[ARIA (manga)|]][/i]. It has 2 different variations depending on the season:

The [[summer uniform|summer]] version consists of a red-trimmed, [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[white shirt|white]][[sailor shirt]] with a [[patch]] with the company [[logo]] on the left sleeve and red [[chevron (symbol)|]] on the other worn over a [[long dress|long]], [[white dress|white]] [[sleeveless dress]]. 

The [[winter uniform|winter]] version replaces the shirt with a [[white capelet]] with yellow or [[gold trim|golden trims]] and a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]], [[high collar|high-collared]] [[white dress]], a long-sleeved [[white shirt|white]] [[undershirt]] and a [[purple pantyhose]].

The dress in both versions has red trims and prominently features the company [[logo]] in red on both the front and the back, and is surprisingly [[skin tight]], almost to the point of being an [[impossible dress]] and has a cutout either on the front or the [[side slit|side]] of one of the legs.

Both versions feature [[red shoes|red]] [[pumps]], a [[red bowtie]] and a red-trimmed [[white headwear|white]] [[hat|cap]].

h4. See also
* [[Aria Company uniform]]
* [[Orange Planet uniform]]
* [[List of uniforms]]

title: color_timer
body:
A [[light bulb]]-like instrument usually attached on an [[Ultra Series|Ultraman]]'s chest. Emitting a steady, blue light at full power, it blinks red if an Ultraman is running out of power or if he is approaching to his time limit. If the Color Timer stops emitting light, it signals either the death of an Ultraman or he'll simply reverts back to his human form. It is also known as the "[b]Warning Light[/b]" in the English dub.

Its name differs, depending on which universe, for example; in [[Ultraman Gaia|Gaia]]'s world, it's known as the [b]Life Gauge[/b], or in [[Ultraman Nexus|Nexus]]' world, it's the [b]Energy Core[/b]. And the U40 Ultras instead obtain a similar item known as the [b]Star Symbols[/b].

title: katharine_ohare
body:
Character from [[Strike Witches: Suomus Misfits Squadron]].

A Pilot Officer from Liberion serving in the [[507th Joint Fighter Wing]]. Known as "Crasher O'Hare" due to her propensity fro crashing her Striker Unit (either by clumsiness or bad luck).

Her weapons include a M2 Heavy Machine Gun, a M1919 A6, a Breda-SAFAT 12.7 mm machine gun, and a Colt SAA Revolver. In her original desigin, her familiar is the Abyssinian cat, but this was later changed to a raccoon, and she's based on Butch O'Hare.

title: rouge_the_bat
body:
[b]Rouge the Bat[/b] is a sassy [[white fur|white-furred]] [[bat girl|bat]] who works as a government spy and loves hunting for jewels. She is on good terms with [[shadow the hedgehog|Shadow]] and [[E-123 Omega]], while she maintains a playful rivalry with [[knuckles the echidna|Knuckles]] since she wants the Master Emerald that he protects (she actually likes Knuckles but will never admit it).

title: infinite_(sonic)
body:
An antagonist character introduced in [[Sonic Forces]]. Under [[Dr. Eggman]]'s command, he was able to defeat [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] using the power of the Phantom Ruby prototype [[chest jewel|in his chest]]. He is also able to create illusory copies of elements such as the environment or enemies of previous games (namely [[shadow_the_hedgehog|Shadow]], [[Metal Sonic]], [[Zavok (sonic)|]] and [[Chaos (sonic)|]]).
He was originally part of a mercenary group called the [[Jackal]] Squad, until they were all defeated by [[shadow_the hedgehog|Shadow]]. Under the [[mask]], he has [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] [[blue_eyes|blue]] and [[yellow eyes]].
other_names: インフィニット(ソニックフォース)

title: cream_the_rabbit
body:
A character from the [[sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series.

She's an anthropomorphic peach [[rabbit]] who made her debut in the 2002 release of [[Sonic Advance 2]], then [[Sonic X]], and finally making her canon debut in the 2003 release of [[Sonic Heroes]]. She's the daughter of [[Vanilla the Rabbit]]. She's generally a very cheery girl, who's always seen with her [[chao (sonic)|Chao]], [[Cheese (sonic)|Cheese]].

The fandom [[meme|memes]] about her being absurdly powerful due to how strong she is in [[sonic heroes|Heroes]] and [[Sonic Advance 2|Advance 2]].

h4. External links

* "Sonic Wiki: Cream the Rabbit":[https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Cream_the_Rabbit]
other_names: クリーム・ザ・ラビット

title: akashi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese repair ship [i]Akashi[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[pink hair]] with [[blunt tresses|freshly cut strands]] held by [[tress_ribbon|red tress ribbons]], as well as [[green eyes]].

The playable and NPC versions of Akashi have slightly different outfits. Both versions wear a [[serafuku]] (identical to [[Ooyodo (kancolle)|]]'s) on top of a [[long_sleeves|long-sleeved]] zippered shirt, along with a [[blue_skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]] with hakama-like [[hip_vent|hip vents]] and [[thighhighs]]. The NPC version has white stripes along the bottom edge of her skirt while the playable version has a wider red stripe along the edge.

The playable version wears pieces of [[armor]], propeller platform shoes and she has several cranes attached to her ship parts. Once remodeled, she wears a white [[bandana]] and actual weapons (mostly anti-air guns) are attached to her.

As an NPC, she runs the premium shop and the Large Ship Construction system. 

As a playable character, she is used to slowly repair minor damage to other ships if she is the flagship of a fleet. When set as secretary ship (first fleet flagship), she is able to improve equipment in her armory arsenal.

Naturally, she is usually paired with fellow NPC [[Ooyodo (kancolle)|]]. She is also occasionally paired with [[Yuubari (kancolle)|]], usually featuring their mutual love of tinkering with and improving equipment.

title: emerl_(sonic)
body:
An ancient [[humanoid robot]] that appears in [[Sonic Battle]]. Its original name was "Gizoid", but the name Emerl was given because of its ability to absorb [[chaos_emerald|Chaos Emeralds]].

Having been first researched upon by [[Gerald Robotnik]], It was discovered and subsequently abandoned by [[Dr. Eggman]]. Afterwards, Emerl begins traveling alongside [[sonic_the_hedgehog|Sonic]] and each of his friends, and grows gradually smarter and stronger by imitating their abilities and absorbing Emeralds. However, gaining power over one of Eggman's weapons forces Sonic to fight Emerl himself.

A different robot called [[Gemerl]] was created from Emerl's data, following its eventual destruction.

H4. External links
* "Sonic Fandom Wiki":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Emerl

title: star_wars:_empire_at_war
body: Star Wars: Empire at War is a 2006 real-time strategy video game developed by Petroglyph Games and published by LucasArts for Microsoft Windows and Mac OS X. Set between Episode III and Episode IV, it focuses on the fledgling struggle between the Empire and the Rebels. It uses Petroglyph's game engine Alamo. In October 2006, an expansion titled Star Wars: Empire at War: Forces of Corruption was released.

title: fate/stay_night
body:
An eroge by [[Type-Moon]], released in January 2004 and made into a 24-episode TV anime in 2006. The game is the first installment of the [[Fate (series)|]] franchise.

Original character designs and most official art made by [[Takeuchi Takashi]].

Consists of three divergent routes, each focusing on a different heroine:

* [[Fate/Stay Night]] - [[Saber (fate)|]]
* [[Fate/Unlimited Blade Works]] - [[Tohsaka Rin]]
* [[Heaven's Feel]] - [[Matou Sakura]]

Note that the above route tags should only be used when the pictures specifically mention said route, or when they show an event that only appears in it. 

The sequel is [[Fate/Hollow Ataraxia]].

title: little_planet_(sonic)
body:
A location in the [[Sonic (series)|]] series that first appeared in [[Sonic CD]]. It is a small [[planet]] that floats above Never Lake. When it is under [[Dr. Eggman]]'s control, it appears encased in metal and attached to a chain. [[Time Warp sign (sonic)|]]s are scattered across the planet, allowing Sonic to travel to the past, as well as both good and bad futures.

This tag should only be used when the planet itself is visible, not for the in-game stages.

title: fate/apocrypha
body:
A 2012-2014 light novel spin-off of the [[Fate_(series)|]] series, written by Higashide Yuuichirou and illustrated by [[Konoe Ototsugu]].

Fate/Apocrypha is based around a parallel world to the [[Fate/stay night|]] canon, where the Holy Grail was removed from Fuyuki City after the third War. The plot focuses on the reappearance of the Grail at Trifas during the 2000s (around the time the fifth Fuyuki War would have occurred) and the rivalry between the Black and Red Factions, each composed of renegades and loyalists to the Mage's Association, respectively, each summoning seven Servants of each type, with the Grail itself summoning [[Jeanne d'Arc (fate)|]] as mediator.

A manga adaptation has been serialized in [[Comp Ace]] magazine since 2016. An anime adaptation aired in 2017.

title: gnarly_knuckles
body:
A character from [i][[Sonic Prime]][/i]. He is an anthropomorphic echidna who is the Boscage Maze counterpart of [[Knuckles the Echidna]] from the main Sonic universe. He is part of a group called the Scavengers who protect the forest.

Gnarly is characterized by his extreme paranoia and suspicion of everything around him. He wears a hat made of leaves held together by rope, and his gloves have plant thorns instead of the typical spikes found on the original Knuckles' gloves. He fights using a spear that he can throw with great precision.

She pilots the [[Strike Rouge Gundam]] in both series and the [[Akatsuki Gundam]] in [[Gundam SEED Destiny]].

title: joy_boy_(one_piece)
body:
Prominent background character from [[One Piece]].

[b]Note: Major spoilers below:[/b]
[spoiler]Joy Boy was born around 900 years ago, and later on he would be known as the first pirate in history. He possesses the Hito Hito no Mi - Model: Nika Devil Fruit which allows him to transform into the Sun God Nika and uses his rubbery properties.

He sided with the "Great Kingdom" in a great war against the First Twenty alliance (the precursor of the World Government) and were defeated. After that, he left a treasure of unimaginable value later known as "One Piece" at the island of Laugh Tale, which [[Gol D. Roger]] later discovered. Due to his stance against the World Government, he was erased from the history as a part of the forbidden "Void Century".

It is said that the arrival of the avatar of Nika is the sign of the world heading towards the turning point. Currently, [[Monkey D. Luffy]] is the one who possesses the same Devil Fruit that Joy Boy possesses.

title: angel_food_cake
body:
A type of [[sponge cake]] that uses no butter, resulting in a very specific texture. Commonly comes in a rectangular shape or as a donut-shape similar to a [[bundt cake]] but without the fluted sides.

Commonly baked in a donut-shaped angel food cake pan, similar to a bundt pan but with taller flat sides and frequently a removable bottom.

title: junpei_(kyokugen_dasshutsu)
body:
A central character in all three [[Kyokugen Dasshutsu]] games, and the protagonist of [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|9 Jikan 9 Nin 9 no Tobira]]. Has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes|brown]] or [[red eyes]]. [[kurashiki akane|Akane Kurashiki]] is his childhood friend and love interest.

In 999, he wears a [[blue vest]], [[grey hoodie]], and [[red shirt|red]] [[flannel]] shirt, as well as [[blue pants]] and [[blue shoes]].

[spoiler]For his appearance in [[kyokugen dasshutsu adv: zennin shibou desu|Zennin Shibou Desu]], see [[Tenmyouji (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]].[/spoiler]

In [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]], he is a member of "C-Team" alongside Akane and [[Carlos (kyokugen dasshutsu)|]]. He wears a [[black shirt|black]] [[V-neck]] [[T-shirt]], [[black pants]], and [[black shoes]]. His character art depicts him with a [[black jacket|black]] [[leather jacket]], but he does not wear it in the game itself.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25438552: [[kyokugen dasshutsu: 9 jikan 9 nin 9 no tobira|999]]
* !asset #25438548: [[zero escape: toki no dilemma|Toki no Dilemma]]

title: hot_cross_bun
body:
A sweet bun made with currants or raisins and marked with a white cross on the top made out of a paste of flour and water. In Christianity, it's traditionally eaten on Good Friday to commemorate Jesus Christ's crucifixion.

title: swiss_cheese
body:
A type of [[cheese]] that has multiple holes in it. Often stereotypically and mistakenly associated as a favorite food of a [[rat]] due to it being the favorite food of [[Jerry (tom and jerry)|]] from [[Tom and Jerry]].

In real life, the coloration of swiss cheese lean toward pale yellow or white. Depictions in fiction on the other hand can make it deeper shades of yellow or even orange.

h4.See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]

title: scarf
body:
A garment that consists of a thin cloth far longer than it is wide. The actual length tends to vary. The garment is typically worn wrapped around the neck during the fall or winter when it is cold out.

Known to be worn by ninjas as a sort of trademark.

title: bread_bun
body:
A type of [[bread]] roll which has a rounded shape. This is a catch-all term for any bread buns.

Some buns may have fillings inside, while sliced ones are prominently used on [[burger]]s and [[submarine sandwich]]es.

h4. See also

title: kagurabachi
body:
[[Weekly Shounen Jump]] manga series created by [[Hokazono Takeru]] in 2023, following the story of [[Rokuhira Chihiro]].


Prior to its debut, its first chapter was leaked a week ahead of time. In response to several elements in the chapter itself, as well as the overarching discourse at the time over WSJ's line-up, the manga received an abnormal amount of attention on the online West, ironically labeling it the magazine's new torchbearer in a meme campaign comparable to that of [[Morbius (film)|]], which then promptly led many to label it an 'industry plant'. Typical references to the meme include [[kagurabachi pose (meme)|edits and redraws]] of the "key art":[/posts/6707029] released with the manga's debut "announcement":[https://www.oricon.co.jp/news/2294136/full/]. The aftermath of the meme would see appreciation for the manga go from the ironic to the sincere, due to its genuine quality.

title: witchcrafter_madame_verre
body:
Smug spellcaster [[duel monster]] and head of the Witchcrafter guild. She plays a huge role in the Endymion storyline, alongside [[Aleister (yu-gi-oh!)|Aleister]] and [[endymion (yu-gi-oh!)|Endymion]].

[[Rilliona the Magistus of Verre]] is her older form. [spoiler]Or, to be more accurate, her younger form. As Rilliona was killed during Aleister's rampage on the Endymion's citadel, she was revived by her golem servant [[Witchcrafter Golem Aruru|Aruru]] as a child afterwards.[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[Rilliona (Yu-Gi-Oh!)]] - umbrella tag for Rilliona's variants
